shloks.simpleMeaning: The Supreme Lord said: Hear again, O mighty-armed Arjuna, My supreme word, which I shall speak to you who are dear to Me, for your benefit.
shloks.practicalExplanation: Krishna continues teaching because Arjuna is dear to Him and He desires Arjuna's welfare. Divine instruction flows from divine love. The teacher-student relationship is perfected when love motivates teaching. Krishna speaks not to show His knowledge but to benefit His beloved devotee.
shloks.strengthReflection: I am dear to the Divine, who teaches me for my highest welfare.
shloks.devotionalSurrender: O Lord, I receive Your words as expressions of Your love for me.

shloks.sanskrit: न मे विदुः सुरगणाः प्रभवं न महर्षयः। अहमादिर्हि देवानां महर्षीणां च सर्वशः॥
shloks.transliteration: na me viduḥ sura-gaṇāḥ prabhavaṁ na maharṣhayaḥ aham ādir hi devānāṁ maharṣhīṇāṁ cha sarvaśhaḥ
shloks.simpleMeaning: Neither the hosts of gods nor the great sages know My origin, for I am the source of all the gods and great sages in every way.
shloks.practicalExplanation: Even celestial beings and realized sages don't fully comprehend Krishna's origin — because He is their origin. The created cannot fully comprehend the Creator. This should humble us: the Divine always exceeds our understanding. Yet this mystery invites endless exploration.
shloks.strengthReflection: I approach the Divine with appropriate humility, knowing the infinite exceeds my grasp.
shloks.devotionalSurrender: O Lord, You are the source of all — even gods and sages wonder at Your mystery.

shloks.sanskrit: यो मामजमनादिं च वेत्ति लोकमहेश्वरम्। असंमूढः स मर्त्येषु सर्वपापैः प्रमुच्यते॥
shloks.transliteration: yo mām ajam anādiṁ cha vetti loka-maheśhvaram asanmūḍhaḥ sa martyeṣhu sarva-pāpaiḥ pramuchyate
shloks.simpleMeaning: He who knows Me as unborn, without beginning, the great Lord of all worlds — he, undeluded among mortals, is freed from all sins.
shloks.practicalExplanation: Knowing Krishna as eternal (unborn, beginningless) and supreme (Lord of worlds) brings liberation. This isn't intellectual knowledge but transformative recognition. When you truly know the Divine as infinite, your limited self-identity dissolves, and with it, all sense of sin.
shloks.strengthReflection: True knowledge of the Divine as eternal and supreme frees me from all limitation.
shloks.devotionalSurrender: O unborn, beginningless Lord of all — knowing You, I am freed from all darkness.

shloks.sanskrit: बुद्धिर्ज्ञानमसंमोहः क्षमा सत्यं दमः शमः। सुखं दुःखं भवोऽभावो भयं चाभयमेव च॥
shloks.transliteration: buddhir jñānam asammohaḥ kṣhamā satyaṁ damaḥ śhamaḥ sukhaṁ duḥkhaṁ bhavo 'bhāvo bhayaṁ chābhayam eva cha
shloks.simpleMeaning: Intelligence, knowledge, freedom from delusion, forgiveness, truthfulness, self-control, calmness, happiness, sorrow, birth, death, fear, and fearlessness...
shloks.practicalExplanation: Krishna begins listing qualities that come from Him. These include mental capacities (intelligence, knowledge), moral virtues (forgiveness, truthfulness), inner states (calmness, happiness), and existential experiences (birth, death, fear). All these, positive and negative, originate in the Divine.
shloks.strengthReflection: All my capacities — mental, moral, and emotional — have their source in the Divine.
shloks.devotionalSurrender: Lord, You are the source of all my abilities and experiences. I honor You in them all.

shloks.sanskrit: अहिंसा समता तुष्टिस्तपो दानं यशोऽयशः। भवन्ति भावा भूतानां मत्त एव पृथग्विधाः॥
shloks.transliteration: ahinsā samatā tuṣhṭis tapo dānaṁ yaśho 'yaśhaḥ bhavanti bhāvā bhūtānāṁ matta eva pṛithag-vidhāḥ
shloks.simpleMeaning: Non-violence, equanimity, contentment, austerity, charity, fame, and infamy — all these various states of beings arise from Me alone.
shloks.practicalExplanation: The list continues: non-violence, equanimity, contentment, discipline, generosity, honor, and dishonor. All the diverse states of all beings come from Krishna. This comprehensive statement means nothing exists separately from the Divine source — even what we label as negative has its origin in Him.
shloks.strengthReflection: I see the Divine hand behind all the varied states of existence.
shloks.devotionalSurrender: O Lord, every quality in creation comes from You. Help me see You in all.

shloks.sanskrit: महर्षयः सप्त पूर्वे चत्वारो मनवस्तथा। मद्भावा मानसा जाता येषां लोक इमाः प्रजाः॥
shloks.transliteration: maharṣhayaḥ sapta pūrve chatvāro manavas tathā mad-bhāvā mānasā jātā yeṣhāṁ loka imāḥ prajāḥ
shloks.simpleMeaning: The seven great sages, the four ancient ones, and the Manus were born from My mind, endowed with My power, and all beings in the world descend from them.
shloks.practicalExplanation: The divine genealogy: the primordial sages and progenitors emerged from God's mind. All living beings descend from these original beings. The entire family tree of creation has its root in Divine thought. We are all related through this divine origin.
shloks.strengthReflection: All beings share a common divine origin — we are one spiritual family.
shloks.devotionalSurrender: O Lord, You are the ultimate ancestor of all. We all come from Your mind.

shloks.sanskrit: एतां विभूतिं योगं च मम यो वेत्ति तत्त्वतः। सोऽविकम्पेन योगेन युज्यते नात्र संशयः॥
shloks.transliteration: etāṁ vibhūtiṁ yogaṁ cha mama yo vetti tattvataḥ so 'vikampena yogena yujyate nātra sanśhayaḥ
shloks.simpleMeaning: One who truly knows My divine glory and My yogic power becomes united with Me through unwavering yoga. Of this there is no doubt.
shloks.practicalExplanation: Knowing God's divine manifestations (vibhuti) and His power (yoga) firmly establishes one in unshakeable union. This knowledge creates stability in spiritual life. Understanding how the Divine pervades everything prevents the mind from wandering — where can it go that isn't God?
shloks.strengthReflection: Understanding divine manifestations everywhere creates unshakeable spiritual stability.
shloks.devotionalSurrender: O Lord, knowing Your glory in all things, I remain ever united with You.

shloks.sanskrit: अहं सर्वस्य प्रभवो मत्तः सर्वं प्रवर्तते। इति मत्वा भजन्ते मां बुधा भावसमन्विताः॥
shloks.transliteration: ahaṁ sarvasya prabhavo mattaḥ sarvaṁ pravartate iti matvā bhajante māṁ budhā bhāva-samanvitāḥ
shloks.simpleMeaning: I am the origin of all; from Me everything proceeds. Understanding this, the wise worship Me with great devotion.
shloks.practicalExplanation: The essence of wisdom: God is the source of all; everything flows from God. Those who truly understand this worship with heartfelt devotion. It's not mere intellectual agreement but deep emotional recognition that transforms the knower into a devoted worshipper.
shloks.strengthReflection: Understanding that everything flows from the Divine naturally inspires my worship.
shloks.devotionalSurrender: O Lord, You are the source of all. From this understanding, my devotion flows.

shloks.sanskrit: मच्चित्ता मद्गतप्राणा बोधयन्तः परस्परम्। कथयन्तश्च मां नित्यं तुष्यन्ति च रमन्ति च॥
shloks.transliteration: mach-chittā mad-gata-prāṇā bodhayantaḥ parasparam kathayantaśh cha māṁ nityaṁ tuṣhyanti cha ramanti cha
shloks.simpleMeaning: With minds fixed on Me, their lives surrendered to Me, enlightening one another, and always speaking of Me, they are satisfied and delighted.
shloks.practicalExplanation: The life of devotees: minds on God, lives offered to God, constant spiritual conversation, and profound satisfaction. This describes sangha — spiritual community where devotees mutually inspire each other. The natural result is deep contentment (tushti) and delight (ramanti).
shloks.strengthReflection: Spiritual community, united in divine focus, brings deep satisfaction and joy.
shloks.devotionalSurrender: O Lord, let my mind rest in You, my life serve You, my conversations celebrate You.

shloks.sanskrit: तेषां सततयुक्तानां भजतां प्रीतिपूर्वकम्। ददामि बुद्धियोगं तं येन मामुपयान्ति ते॥
shloks.transliteration: teṣhāṁ satata-yuktānāṁ bhajatāṁ prīti-pūrvakam dadāmi buddhi-yogaṁ taṁ yena mām upayānti te
shloks.simpleMeaning: To those who are constantly devoted and worship Me with love, I give the yoga of understanding by which they come to Me.
shloks.practicalExplanation: Krishna's gift to devoted lovers: buddhi-yoga, the divine understanding that leads directly to Him. This isn't earned through effort alone but given as grace to those who love Him constantly. The devoted receive divine intelligence that guides them home.
shloks.strengthReflection: Through constant devotion, I receive divine intelligence that guides me to God.
shloks.devotionalSurrender: O Lord, I worship You with love. Give me the understanding that leads to You.

shloks.sanskrit: तेषामेवानुकम्पार्थमहमज्ञानजं तमः। नाशयाम्यात्मभावस्थो ज्ञानदीपेन भास्वता॥
shloks.transliteration: teṣhām evānukampārtham aham ajñāna-jaṁ tamaḥ nāśhayāmy ātma-bhāva-stho jñāna-dīpena bhāsvatā
shloks.simpleMeaning: Out of compassion for them, I, dwelling within their hearts, destroy the darkness born of ignorance with the shining lamp of knowledge.
shloks.practicalExplanation: The most intimate teaching: God dwells within the heart of His devotees and, from within, illuminates their darkness. The lamp of knowledge shines from inside, not outside. This is grace in action — the Divine personally dispelling ignorance for those who love Him.
shloks.strengthReflection: The Divine dwells in my heart, personally illuminating my inner darkness.
shloks.devotionalSurrender: O Lord, shining within my heart, destroy my ignorance with Your light.

shloks.sanskrit: अर्जुन उवाच। परं ब्रह्म परं धाम पवित्रं परमं भवान्। पुरुषं शाश्वतं दिव्यमादिदेवमजं विभुम्॥
shloks.transliteration: arjuna uvācha paraṁ brahma paraṁ dhāma pavitraṁ paramaṁ bhavān puruṣhaṁ śhāśhvataṁ divyam ādi-devam ajaṁ vibhum
shloks.simpleMeaning: Arjuna said: You are the Supreme Brahman, the supreme abode, the supreme purifier — the eternal divine person, the primordial God, unborn and all-pervading.
shloks.practicalExplanation: Arjuna's recognition peaks: Krishna is the supreme reality, the ultimate refuge, the source of all purity, the eternal divine person, the original God, beyond birth, present everywhere. This is the disciple's recognition that opens the door to full transmission.
shloks.strengthReflection: I recognize the Divine in all its aspects: supreme reality, refuge, and purifier.
shloks.devotionalSurrender: O Supreme Lord, primordial and eternal, unborn and all-pervading — I recognize You.

shloks.sanskrit: आहुस्त्वामृषयः सर्वे देवर्षिर्नारदस्तथा। असितो देवलो व्यासः स्वयं चैव ब्रवीषि मे॥
shloks.transliteration: āhus tvām ṛiṣhayaḥ sarve devarṣhir nāradas tathā asito devalo vyāsaḥ svayaṁ chaiva bravīṣhi me
shloks.simpleMeaning: All the sages proclaim this of You — the divine sage Narada, as well as Asita, Devala, and Vyasa — and now You Yourself are telling me so.
shloks.practicalExplanation: Arjuna's faith isn't blind — it's confirmed by the testimony of all great sages: Narada, Asita, Devala, Vyasa. And now Krishna Himself confirms it directly. Truth is validated by lineage of seers and direct experience. Both tradition and revelation agree.
shloks.strengthReflection: My faith is supported by the wisdom of sages and direct divine revelation.
shloks.devotionalSurrender: Lord, all sages proclaim Your glory, and You confirm it Yourself. I believe.

shloks.sanskrit: सर्वमेतदृतं मन्ये यन्मां वदसि केशव। न हि ते भगवन्व्यक्तिं विदुर्देवा न दानवाः॥
shloks.transliteration: sarvam etad ṛitaṁ manye yan māṁ vadasi keśhava na hi te bhagavan vyaktiṁ vidur devā na dānavāḥ
shloks.simpleMeaning: O Keshava, I accept as truth all that You tell me. Indeed, Lord, neither the gods nor the demons know Your manifestation.
shloks.practicalExplanation: Arjuna accepts everything Krishna says as truth. Neither gods nor demons fully know the Divine manifestation — only the Divine can reveal Himself. This acceptance isn't surrender of critical thinking but recognition that some truths exceed ordinary reasoning.
shloks.strengthReflection: I accept divine truth that exceeds ordinary understanding.
shloks.devotionalSurrender: O Lord, I accept all You tell me. You alone can reveal Yourself fully.

shloks.sanskrit: स्वयमेवात्मनात्मानं वेत्थ त्वं पुरुषोत्तम। भूतभावन भूतेश देवदेव जगत्पते॥
shloks.transliteration: svayam evātmanātmānaṁ vettha tvaṁ puruṣhottama bhūta-bhāvana bhūteśha deva-deva jagat-pate
shloks.simpleMeaning: You alone know Yourself by Your own power, O Supreme Person, creator of beings, Lord of beings, God of gods, Lord of the universe!
shloks.practicalExplanation: Only God fully knows God. Self-knowledge is complete only in the Divine. Arjuna praises Krishna with exalted names: Supreme Person, Creator, Lord, God of gods, Master of the universe. These titles acknowledge the absolute nature of Krishna's being.
shloks.strengthReflection: I honor the Divine who alone knows Himself completely.
shloks.devotionalSurrender: O Supreme Lord, only You fully know Yourself. Reveal as much as I can receive.

shloks.sanskrit: वक्तुमर्हस्यशेषेण दिव्या ह्यात्मविभूतयः। याभिर्विभूतिभिर्लोकानिमांस्त्वं व्याप्य तिष्ठसि॥
shloks.transliteration: vaktum arhasy aśheṣheṇa divyā hy ātma-vibhūtayaḥ yābhir vibhūtibhir lokān imāns tvaṁ vyāpya tiṣhṭhasi
shloks.simpleMeaning: You alone can describe fully Your divine glories, by which You pervade all these worlds.
shloks.practicalExplanation: Arjuna requests the teaching that follows: tell me all Your divine manifestations. How do You pervade everything? Where should I look to see You? This eager inquiry sets the stage for Krishna's beautiful enumeration of His presence in all things.
shloks.strengthReflection: I ask the Divine: show me where and how You pervade everything.
shloks.devotionalSurrender: O Lord, reveal Your divine glories. Show me how You pervade all worlds.

shloks.sanskrit: कथं विद्यामहं योगिंस्त्वां सदा परिचिन्तयन्। केषु केषु च भावेषु चिन्त्योऽसि भगवन्मया॥
shloks.transliteration: kathaṁ vidyām ahaṁ yogins tvāṁ sadā parichintayan keṣhu keṣhu cha bhāveṣhu chintyo 'si bhagavan mayā
shloks.simpleMeaning: O Yogi, how may I know You by constant meditation? In what various forms should I contemplate You, O Lord?
shloks.practicalExplanation: Arjuna asks the practical question: How do I meditate on You constantly? What forms should I contemplate? This moves from theory to practice. The answer will give specific objects of meditation — aids for maintaining constant divine awareness.
shloks.strengthReflection: I seek practical guidance for maintaining constant divine awareness.
shloks.devotionalSurrender: O Lord, teach me how to think of You always. Show me what to contemplate.

shloks.sanskrit: विस्तरेणात्मनो योगं विभूतिं च जनार्दन। भूयः कथय तृप्तिर्हि शृण्वतो नास्ति मेऽमृतम्॥
shloks.transliteration: vistareṇātmano yogaṁ vibhūtiṁ cha janārdana bhūyaḥ kathaya tṛiptir hi śhṛiṇvato nāsti me 'mṛitam
shloks.simpleMeaning: Tell me again in detail of Your yogic power and glory, O Janardana. I can never tire of hearing Your immortal words.
shloks.practicalExplanation: Arjuna can't get enough — he wants more! The words of the Divine are like nectar (amrita) that never satisfies fully because they're infinitely sweet. This is the nature of genuine spiritual hunger: the more you receive, the more you want.
shloks.strengthReflection: I cultivate insatiable hunger for divine wisdom, never tiring of spiritual truth.
shloks.devotionalSurrender: O Lord, tell me more! I can never tire of hearing Your immortal words.

shloks.sanskrit: श्रीभगवानुवाच। हन्त ते कथयिष्यामि दिव्या ह्यात्मविभूतयः। प्राधान्यतः कुरुश्रेष्ठ नास्त्यन्तो विस्तरस्य मे॥
shloks.transliteration: śhrī bhagavān uvācha hanta te kathayiṣhyāmi divyā hy ātma-vibhūtayaḥ prādhānyataḥ kuru-śhreṣhṭha nāsty anto vistarasya me
shloks.simpleMeaning: The Supreme Lord said: Yes, I shall tell you of My divine glories, but only the most prominent ones, O best of the Kurus, for there is no end to My extent.
shloks.practicalExplanation: Krishna agrees to share His manifestations but notes they're infinite — He'll share only the highlights. The Divine extent is endless. Any list is incomplete. But even partial revelation transforms vision. Knowing some is better than knowing none.
shloks.strengthReflection: Even partial knowledge of divine glory transforms my perception of reality.
shloks.devotionalSurrender: O Lord, share what You will. Even highlights of Your glory are infinite blessings.

shloks.sanskrit: अहमात्मा गुडाकेश सर्वभूताशयस्थितः। अहमादिश्च मध्यं च भूतानामन्त एव च॥
shloks.transliteration: aham ātmā guḍākeśha sarva-bhūtāśhaya-sthitaḥ aham ādiśh cha madhyaṁ cha bhūtānām anta eva cha
shloks.simpleMeaning: O Arjuna, I am the Self seated in the hearts of all beings. I am the beginning, the middle, and the end of all beings.
shloks.practicalExplanation: The first and greatest manifestation: Krishna is the Self (Atman) in all hearts. He is also the beginning, middle, and end of everything. Whatever exists has Krishna as its inner essence and its total time span. This is the foundation for all other examples.
shloks.strengthReflection: The Divine is my innermost Self and the beginning, middle, and end of my existence.
shloks.devotionalSurrender: O Lord, You are the Self in my heart, my origin, my journey, my destination.

shloks.sanskrit: आदित्यानामहं विष्णुर्ज्योतिषां रविरंशुमान्। मरीचिर्मरुतामस्मि नक्षत्राणामहं शशी॥
shloks.transliteration: ādityānām ahaṁ viṣhṇur jyotiṣhāṁ ravir anśhumān marīchir marutām asmi nakṣhatrāṇām ahaṁ śhaśhī
shloks.simpleMeaning: Among the Adityas, I am Vishnu; among luminaries, the radiant sun; among the Maruts, I am Marichi; among stars, I am the moon.
shloks.practicalExplanation: Krishna is Vishnu among divine beings, the sun among lights, Marichi among wind-gods, the moon among stars. In every category, He is the most excellent. Look at any group — the best represents Him most clearly.
shloks.strengthReflection: In every category of existence, the most excellent points to the Divine.
shloks.devotionalSurrender: Lord, I see You in the sun, the moon, the brightest and best of everything.

shloks.sanskrit: वेदानां सामवेदोऽस्मि देवानामस्मि वासवः। इन्द्रियाणां मनश्चास्मि भूतानामस्मि चेतना॥
shloks.transliteration: vedānāṁ sāma-vedo 'smi devānām asmi vāsavaḥ indriyāṇāṁ manaśh chāsmi bhūtānām asmi chetanā
shloks.simpleMeaning: Of the Vedas, I am the Sama Veda; of the gods, I am Indra; of the senses, I am the mind; and in living beings, I am consciousness.
shloks.practicalExplanation: Among Vedas, the musical Sama Veda; among gods, Indra the king; among senses, the mind that coordinates all; among beings, consciousness itself. Krishna is the organizing principle, the royal essence, the awareness behind all sensing.
shloks.strengthReflection: The awareness that reads these words is a manifestation of the Divine.
shloks.devotionalSurrender: O Lord, You are the consciousness making me aware. I find You in my own awareness.

shloks.sanskrit: रुद्राणां शङ्करश्चास्मि वित्तेशो यक्षरक्षसाम्। वसूनां पावकश्चास्मि मेरुः शिखरिणामहम्॥
shloks.transliteration: rudrāṇāṁ śhaṅkaraśh chāsmi vitteśho yakṣha-rakṣhasām vasūnāṁ pāvakaśh chāsmi meruḥ śhikhariṇām aham
shloks.simpleMeaning: Of the Rudras, I am Shankara (Shiva); of the Yakshas and Rakshasas, I am Kubera; of the Vasus, I am fire; and of mountains, I am Meru.
shloks.practicalExplanation: Among Rudras, Shiva the auspicious; among nature spirits, Kubera the wealthy lord; among Vasus, fire the purifying; among mountains, Meru the cosmic axis. Each domain has its peak expression — that expression is Krishna.
shloks.strengthReflection: Every domain of existence has its highest expression, pointing to the Divine.
shloks.devotionalSurrender: Lord, You are Shiva, the cosmic mountain, the sacred fire. I see You in all peaks.

shloks.sanskrit: पुरोधसां च मुख्यं मां विद्धि पार्थ बृहस्पतिम्। सेनानीनामहं स्कन्दः सरसामस्मि सागरः॥
shloks.transliteration: purodhasāṁ cha mukhyaṁ māṁ viddhi pārtha bṛihaspatim senānīnām ahaṁ skandaḥ sarasām asmi sāgaraḥ
shloks.simpleMeaning: Of priests, know Me to be the chief, Brihaspati; of generals, I am Skanda; of bodies of water, I am the ocean.
shloks.practicalExplanation: Among priests, Brihaspati the guru of gods; among military leaders, Skanda the divine commander; among waters, the ocean that receives all rivers. Leadership, power, receptivity — all have their divine exemplar.
shloks.strengthReflection: Leadership, power, and vast receptivity all reflect the Divine.
shloks.devotionalSurrender: Lord, You are the highest priest, the greatest leader, the infinite ocean.

shloks.sanskrit: महर्षीणां भृगुरहं गिरामस्म्येकमक्षरम्। यज्ञानां जपयज्ञोऽस्मि स्थावराणां हिमालयः॥
shloks.transliteration: maharṣhīṇāṁ bhṛigur ahaṁ girām asmy ekam akṣharam yajñānāṁ japa-yajño 'smi sthāvarāṇāṁ himālayaḥ
shloks.simpleMeaning: Of the great sages, I am Bhrigu; of words, I am Om; of sacrifices, I am the sacrifice of chanting; of immovable things, I am the Himalayas.
shloks.practicalExplanation: Among sages, Bhrigu the fiery; among words, the single syllable Om; among sacrifices, japa (silent repetition); among mountains, the Himalayas. The simplest, most universal, and most majestic — all represent the Divine.
shloks.strengthReflection: Om, the simplest utterance, and the Himalayas, the most majestic — both are Divine.
shloks.devotionalSurrender: Lord, You are Om on my lips and the Himalayas before my eyes.

shloks.sanskrit: अश्वत्थः सर्ववृक्षाणां देवर्षीणां च नारदः। गन्धर्वाणां चित्ररथः सिद्धानां कपिलो मुनिः॥
shloks.transliteration: aśhvatthaḥ sarva-vṛikṣhāṇāṁ devarṣhīṇāṁ cha nāradaḥ gandharvāṇāṁ chitrarathaḥ siddhānāṁ kapilo muniḥ
shloks.simpleMeaning: Of trees, I am the sacred fig tree (Ashvattha); of divine sages, Narada; of celestial musicians, Chitraratha; of perfected ones, the sage Kapila.
shloks.practicalExplanation: Among trees, the sacred peepal; among divine sages, Narada the wandering devotee; among celestial musicians, Chitraratha; among perfected beings, Kapila founder of Sankhya. Nature, devotion, art, philosophy — each has its divine exemplar.
shloks.strengthReflection: In nature, music, and philosophy, the highest expressions reveal the Divine.
shloks.devotionalSurrender: Lord, in the sacred tree, in divine music, in profound philosophy — I find You.

shloks.sanskrit: उच्चैःश्रवसमश्वानां विद्धि माममृतोद्भवम्। ऐरावतं गजेन्द्राणां नराणां च नराधिपम्॥
shloks.transliteration: uchchaiḥśhravasam aśhvānāṁ viddhi mām amṛitodbhavam airāvataṁ gajendrāṇāṁ narāṇāṁ cha narādhipam
shloks.simpleMeaning: Know Me among horses as Ucchaihshravas, born of nectar; among elephants, Airavata; and among humans, the king.
shloks.practicalExplanation: Among horses, the divine steed from the churning of the ocean; among elephants, Indra's mount; among humans, the king. Each type has its supreme representative — speed, strength, leadership — all divine.
shloks.strengthReflection: Speed, strength, and noble leadership all reflect aspects of the Divine.
shloks.devotionalSurrender: Lord, in the swiftest, strongest, and most noble, I see Your manifestation.

shloks.sanskrit: आयुधानामहं वज्रं धेनूनामस्मि कामधुक्। प्रजनश्चास्मि कन्दर्पः सर्पाणामस्मि वासुकिः॥
shloks.transliteration: āyudhānām ahaṁ vajraṁ dhenūnām asmi kāma-dhuk prajanaśh chāsmi kandarpaḥ sarpāṇām asmi vāsukiḥ
shloks.simpleMeaning: Of weapons, I am the thunderbolt; of cows, I am the wish-fulfilling Kamadhenu; I am the progenitor Kandarpa (Cupid); of serpents, I am Vasuki.
shloks.practicalExplanation: Among weapons, Indra's invincible thunderbolt; among cows, the wish-granting Kamadhenu; the creative desire Kandarpa; among serpents, Vasuki king of snakes. Power, abundance, creativity, and even what seems dangerous — all have their divine aspect.
shloks.strengthReflection: Power, abundance, creativity, and even mystery manifest the Divine.
shloks.devotionalSurrender: Lord, You are the power that protects, the abundance that nourishes, the creativity that continues life.

shloks.sanskrit: अनन्तश्चास्मि नागानां वरुणो यादसामहम्। पितॄणामर्यमा चास्मि यमः संयमतामहम्॥
shloks.transliteration: anantaśh chāsmi nāgānāṁ varuṇo yādasām aham pitṝīṇām aryamā chāsmi yamaḥ sanyamatām aham
shloks.simpleMeaning: Of the Nagas, I am Ananta (Sesha); of water deities, Varuna; of ancestors, Aryama; and of controllers, I am Yama (god of death).
shloks.practicalExplanation: Among cosmic serpents, the infinite Ananta who supports the universe; among ocean lords, Varuna; among ancestors, Aryama; among controllers, Yama who governs death. Eternity, the depths, heritage, and even death are divine manifestations.
shloks.strengthReflection: Even death and the cosmic depths are expressions of the Divine.
shloks.devotionalSurrender: Lord, You are eternity, the depths, my heritage, and even death. You are everywhere.

shloks.sanskrit: प्रह्लादश्चास्मि दैत्यानां कालः कलयतामहम्। मृगाणां च मृगेन्द्रोऽहं वैनतेयश्च पक्षिणाम्॥
shloks.transliteration: prahlādaśh chāsmi daityānāṁ kālaḥ kalayatām aham mṛigāṇāṁ cha mṛigendro 'haṁ vainateyaśh cha pakṣhiṇām
shloks.simpleMeaning: Of the demons, I am Prahlada; of measurers, I am time; of animals, I am the lion; and of birds, I am Garuda.
shloks.practicalExplanation: Even among demons, Krishna is the devotee Prahlada who defied his demonic father for God. Among measures, time that measures all. Among animals, the king lion; among birds, Garuda Vishnu's mount. Devotion triumphs even in demonic realms; time marks all; nobility manifests everywhere.
shloks.strengthReflection: Even in hostile circumstances, devotion can flourish as the Divine manifestation.
shloks.devotionalSurrender: Lord, like Prahlada, may I find You even in demonic surroundings.

shloks.sanskrit: पवनः पवतामस्मि रामः शस्त्रभृतामहम्। झषाणां मकरश्चास्मि स्रोतसामस्मि जाह्नवी॥
shloks.transliteration: pavanaḥ pavatām asmi rāmaḥ śhastra-bhṛitām aham jhaṣhāṇāṁ makaraśh chāsmi srotasām asmi jāhnavī
shloks.simpleMeaning: Of purifiers, I am the wind; of warriors, I am Rama; of fish, the shark; of rivers, the Ganges.
shloks.practicalExplanation: Among purifiers, wind that clears all; among weapon-wielders, Rama the ideal warrior-king; among fish, the mighty shark; among rivers, the sacred Ganges. Purification, righteous strength, power in depths, and sacred flow — all divine.
shloks.strengthReflection: Purification, righteous strength, and sacred flow all manifest the Divine.
shloks.devotionalSurrender: Lord, purify me like wind, strengthen me like Rama, carry me like the Ganges.

shloks.sanskrit: सर्गाणामादिरन्तश्च मध्यं चैवाहमर्जुन। अध्यात्मविद्या विद्यानां वादः प्रवदतामहम्॥
shloks.transliteration: sargāṇām ādir antaśh cha madhyaṁ chaivāham arjuna adhyātma-vidyā vidyānāṁ vādaḥ pravadatām aham
shloks.simpleMeaning: Of creations, I am the beginning, end, and middle, O Arjuna. Of sciences, I am the science of the self; of arguments, I am logic.
shloks.practicalExplanation: Krishna reiterates: He is all of time — beginning, middle, end. Among all knowledge, spiritual self-knowledge is supreme. Among debates, the logical approach. Time, self-knowledge, and reason all have divine foundations.
shloks.strengthReflection: Self-knowledge and logical reasoning reflect the Divine intelligence.
shloks.devotionalSurrender: Lord, You are all of time and the highest knowledge. Guide my reasoning toward You.

shloks.sanskrit: अक्षराणामकारोऽस्मि द्वन्द्वः सामासिकस्य च। अहमेवाक्षयः कालो धाताहं विश्वतोमुखः॥
shloks.transliteration: akṣharāṇām akāro 'smi dvandvaḥ sāmāsikasya cha aham evākṣhayaḥ kālo dhātāhaṁ viśhvato-mukhaḥ
shloks.simpleMeaning: Of letters, I am 'A'; of compounds, I am the dual; I am inexhaustible time; I am the creator facing everywhere.
shloks.practicalExplanation: Among letters, 'A' — the first sound, present in all others. Among compounds, the balanced dual. He is time without end and the creator seeing in all directions. The fundamental, the balanced, the eternal, the omniscient — all divine.
shloks.strengthReflection: The fundamental letter 'A' and eternal time both point to the infinite Divine.
shloks.devotionalSurrender: Lord, from 'A' to eternity, from first to endless, You are all.

shloks.sanskrit: मृत्युः सर्वहरश्चाहमुद्भवश्च भविष्यताम्। कीर्तिः श्रीर्वाक्च नारीणां स्मृतिर्मेधा धृतिः क्षमा॥
shloks.transliteration: mṛityuḥ sarva-haraśh chāham udbhavaśh cha bhaviṣhyatām kīrtiḥ śhrīr vāk cha nārīṇāṁ smṛitir medhā dhṛitiḥ kṣhamā
shloks.simpleMeaning: I am all-devouring death, and I am the origin of future beings. Among feminine qualities, I am fame, fortune, speech, memory, intelligence, firmness, and patience.
shloks.practicalExplanation: Krishna is death that takes everything, and also the emergence of all that's coming. Among feminine divine qualities: fame, prosperity, eloquence, memory, intelligence, steadiness, and forgiveness. Both the ending and the beginning, the tough and the tender — all God.
shloks.strengthReflection: The Divine is both what ends and what begins, both power and grace.
shloks.devotionalSurrender: Lord, You are death and birth, strength and gentleness. I accept all as Your forms.

shloks.sanskrit: बृहत्साम तथा साम्नां गायत्री छन्दसामहम्। मासानां मार्गशीर्षोऽहमृतूनां कुसुमाकरः॥
shloks.transliteration: bṛihat-sāma tathā sāmnāṁ gāyatrī chhandasām aham māsānāṁ mārgaśhīrṣho 'ham ṛitūnāṁ kusumākaraḥ
shloks.simpleMeaning: Of the Sama hymns, I am the Brihat-sama; of meters, I am Gayatri; of months, I am Margashirsha (November-December); of seasons, I am spring.
shloks.practicalExplanation: Among Sama hymns, the great Brihat-sama; among poetic meters, the sacred Gayatri; among months, the auspicious Margashirsha; among seasons, flower-bearing spring. Music, poetry, sacred time, and renewal — all divine expressions.
shloks.strengthReflection: Sacred music, poetry, and the renewal of spring all express divine beauty.
shloks.devotionalSurrender: Lord, in sacred chant, poetic meter, and spring's bloom, I celebrate You.

shloks.sanskrit: द्यूतं छलयतामस्मि तेजस्तेजस्विनामहम्। जयोऽस्मि व्यवसायोऽस्मि सत्त्वं सत्त्ववतामहम्॥
shloks.transliteration: dyūtaṁ chhalayatām asmi tejas tejasvinām aham jayo 'smi vyavasāyo 'smi sattvaṁ sattvavatām aham
shloks.simpleMeaning: Of deceptions, I am gambling; of the splendid, I am splendor; I am victory, determination, and the goodness of the good.
shloks.practicalExplanation: Even gambling — Krishna is the throw of dice that decides! He is the radiance of the radiant, victory itself, determination, and the purity of the pure. Success, willpower, and goodness all have divine foundation.
shloks.strengthReflection: My victories, my determination, and my goodness come from the Divine.
shloks.devotionalSurrender: Lord, You are my victories and my willpower. Strengthen both through Your grace.

shloks.sanskrit: वृष्णीनां वासुदेवोऽस्मि पाण्डवानां धनञ्जयः। मुनीनामप्यहं व्यासः कवीनामुशना कविः॥
shloks.transliteration: vṛiṣhṇīnāṁ vāsudevo 'smi pāṇḍavānāṁ dhanañjayaḥ munīnām apy ahaṁ vyāsaḥ kavīnām uśhanā kaviḥ
shloks.simpleMeaning: Of the Vrishnis, I am Krishna (Vasudeva); of the Pandavas, I am Arjuna; of sages, I am Vyasa; of poets, Ushana.
shloks.practicalExplanation: Among Vrishnis, Krishna Himself! Among Pandavas, Arjuna sitting right there listening! Krishna includes His friend as His own manifestation. Among sages, Vyasa who compiled all Vedic literature; among poets, the brilliant Ushana. The Divine includes and honors His devotees.
shloks.strengthReflection: I too can become a manifestation of the Divine through devotion and excellence.
shloks.devotionalSurrender: Lord, You honor Arjuna as Your manifestation. May I too manifest You.

shloks.sanskrit: दण्डो दमयतामस्मि नीतिरस्मि जिगीषताम्। मौनं चैवास्मि गुह्यानां ज्ञानं ज्ञानवतामहम्॥
shloks.transliteration: daṇḍo damayatām asmi nītir asmi jigīṣhatām maunaṁ chaivāsmi guhyānāṁ jñānaṁ jñānavatām aham
shloks.simpleMeaning: Of means of discipline, I am the rod; of seekers of victory, I am statesmanship; of secrets, I am silence; of the wise, I am wisdom.
shloks.practicalExplanation: Among corrective measures, the rod of discipline; among ways to win, wise policy; among secrets, silence itself; among the knowledgeable, knowledge itself. Justice, strategy, discretion, and wisdom — the Divine foundation of order and intelligence.
shloks.strengthReflection: Wise discipline, strategic thinking, and knowing when to be silent are divine qualities.
shloks.devotionalSurrender: Lord, grant me right discipline, wise strategy, and the wisdom of silence.

shloks.sanskrit: यच्चापि सर्वभूतानां बीजं तदहमर्जुन। न तदस्ति विना यत्स्यान्मया भूतं चराचरम्॥
shloks.transliteration: yach chāpi sarva-bhūtānāṁ bījaṁ tad aham arjuna na tad asti vinā yat syān mayā bhūtaṁ charācharam
shloks.simpleMeaning: O Arjuna, I am the seed of all beings. There is no being, moving or non-moving, that can exist without Me.
shloks.practicalExplanation: The summary statement: Krishna is the seed, the source, the essential cause of all beings. Nothing that moves, nothing that stands still, can exist separately from Him. This is the full declaration of divine omnipresence.
shloks.strengthReflection: Nothing exists without the Divine — I am never alone or separate from God.
shloks.devotionalSurrender: O Lord, You are my source and the ground of my being. Without You I cannot exist.

shloks.sanskrit: नान्तोऽस्ति मम दिव्यानां विभूतीनां परन्तप। एष तूद्देशतः प्रोक्तो विभूतेर्विस्तरो मया॥
shloks.transliteration: nānto 'sti mama divyānāṁ vibhūtīnāṁ parantapa eṣha tūddeśhataḥ prokto vibhūter vistaro mayā
shloks.simpleMeaning: There is no end to My divine glories, O Arjuna. What I have spoken is but a brief indication of My infinite manifestations.
shloks.practicalExplanation: Krishna concludes the list by noting it can never end. What He's shared is only a sample, a brief indication. The Divine manifestation is infinite — every example given is just a portal to endless further discovery. The teaching never ends because God never ends.
shloks.strengthReflection: Every glimpse of divine glory is just a taste of infinite more.
shloks.devotionalSurrender: Lord, what I've learned barely begins to reveal You. Open ever more to me.

shloks.sanskrit: यद्यद्विभूतिमत्सत्त्वं श्रीमदूर्जितमेव वा। तत्तदेवावगच्छ त्वं मम तेजोंऽशसम्भवम्॥
shloks.transliteration: yad yad vibhūtimat sattvaṁ śhrīmad ūrjitam eva vā tat tad evāvagachchha tvaṁ mama tejo 'nśha-sambhavam
shloks.simpleMeaning: Whatever being is glorious, prosperous, or powerful — know that to be a manifestation of a spark of My splendor.
shloks.practicalExplanation: The practical formula: wherever you see glory, prosperity, or power — know it comes from a tiny fraction of divine splendor. This transforms perception. Look at anything excellent and recognize: this is just a spark of the infinite fire. Every excellence points beyond itself.
shloks.strengthReflection: All excellence I see reflects but a spark of infinite divine glory.
shloks.devotionalSurrender: Lord, in every glory, I see Your spark. All excellence praises You.

shloks.sanskrit: अथवा बहुनैतेन किं ज्ञातेन तवार्जुन। विष्टभ्याहमिदं कृत्स्नमेकांशेन स्थितो जगत्॥
shloks.transliteration: atha vā bahunaitena kiṁ jñātena tavārjuna viṣhṭabhyāham idaṁ kṛitsnam ekānśhena sthito jagat
shloks.simpleMeaning: But what need is there for all this detailed knowledge, Arjuna? With a single fragment of Myself, I pervade and support this entire universe.
shloks.practicalExplanation: The chapter's stunning conclusion: forget all the details — with just ONE fragment of His being, Krishna pervades and sustains the entire universe! All the examples are just illustrations of His smallest fraction. The whole universe is a tiny expression of infinite God.
shloks.strengthReflection: The entire universe rests on a fragment of the Divine — I too am held by that infinite support.
shloks.devotionalSurrender: O Lord, the universe is Your tiny fraction. How vast, how infinite You must be!

shloks.sanskrit: अर्जुन उवाच। मदनुग्रहाय परमं गुह्यमध्यात्मसंज्ञितम्। यत्त्वयोक्तं वचस्तेन मोहोऽयं विगतो मम॥
shloks.transliteration: arjuna uvācha madanugrahāya paramaṁ guhyam adhyātma-sanjñitam yat tvayoktaṁ vachas tena moho 'yaṁ vigato mama
shloks.simpleMeaning: Arjuna said: Out of compassion for me, You have revealed the supreme secret concerning the self. By Your words, my delusion is now dispelled.
shloks.practicalExplanation: Arjuna acknowledges Krishna's teaching — given out of pure compassion, it has removed his confusion. This grateful recognition shows the disciple's receptivity. Delusion lifts when sacred teachings enter an open heart.
shloks.strengthReflection: Divine teachings given in compassion dispel my delusions.
shloks.devotionalSurrender: Lord, Your compassionate words have cleared my confusion. I am grateful.

shloks.sanskrit: भवाप्ययौ हि भूतानां श्रुतौ विस्तरशो मया। त्वत्तः कमलपत्राक्ष माहात्म्यमपि चाव्ययम्॥
shloks.transliteration: bhavāpyayau hi bhūtānāṁ śhrutau vistaraśho mayā tvattaḥ kamala-patrākṣha māhātmyam api chāvyayam
shloks.simpleMeaning: O lotus-eyed one, I have heard from You in detail about the origin and dissolution of beings, as well as Your imperishable glories.
shloks.practicalExplanation: Arjuna has heard about creation and dissolution from Krishna's own lips, along with His eternal glories. The teaching has sunk in. Now he wants to see what he has heard described. Knowledge must lead to vision.
shloks.strengthReflection: Having heard divine truth, I aspire to see it directly.
shloks.devotionalSurrender: O lotus-eyed Lord, I have heard Your glories. Now let me see.

shloks.sanskrit: एवमेतद्यथात्थ त्वमात्मानं परमेश्वर। द्रष्टुमिच्छामि ते रूपमैश्वरं पुरुषोत्तम॥
shloks.transliteration: evam etad yathāttha tvam ātmānaṁ parameśhvara draṣhṭum ichchhāmi te rūpam aiśhvaraṁ puruṣhottama
shloks.simpleMeaning: O Supreme Lord, You are as You have described Yourself. I wish to see Your divine cosmic form, O Supreme Person.
shloks.practicalExplanation: Arjuna requests the vision of Krishna's cosmic form. He accepts Krishna's self-description and now wants direct experience. This is the natural progression: faith leads to hearing, hearing creates desire for seeing, and asking opens the door to revelation.
shloks.strengthReflection: I ask for direct experience of divine truth, not content with description alone.
shloks.devotionalSurrender: O Supreme Person, I believe what You say. Now show me Your cosmic form.

shloks.sanskrit: मन्यसे यदि तच्छक्यं मया द्रष्टुमिति प्रभो। योगेश्वर ततो मे त्वं दर्शयात्मानमव्ययम्॥
shloks.transliteration: manyase yadi tach chhakyaṁ mayā draṣhṭum iti prabho yogeśhvara tato me tvaṁ darśhayātmānam avyayam
shloks.simpleMeaning: If You think I am able to behold it, O Lord, O master of yoga, then reveal to me Your imperishable Self.
shloks.practicalExplanation: Arjuna adds humble qualification: 'if You think I'm capable.' Divine vision isn't guaranteed to all — the seer must be ready. Arjuna leaves the decision to Krishna, the master of yoga, acknowledging that the guru knows the disciple's capacity better than the disciple does.
shloks.strengthReflection: I humbly ask for revelation, trusting that God knows my capacity.
shloks.devotionalSurrender: Lord, if You think I'm ready, reveal Yourself. You know my capacity.

shloks.sanskrit: श्रीभगवानुवाच। पश्य मे पार्थ रूपाणि शतशोऽथ सहस्रशः। नानाविधानि दिव्यानि नानावर्णाकृतीनि च॥
shloks.transliteration: śhrī bhagavān uvācha paśhya me pārtha rūpāṇi śhataśho 'tha sahasraśhaḥ nānā-vidhāni divyāni nānā-varṇākṛitīni cha
shloks.simpleMeaning: The Supreme Lord said: Behold, O Arjuna, My divine forms by the hundreds and thousands, various, divine, of many colors and shapes.
shloks.practicalExplanation: Krishna grants the vision. Not one form but hundreds, thousands — endless varieties, divine, multicolored, multi-shaped. The singular becomes plural, the limited becomes infinite. What Arjuna will see exceeds anything describable.
shloks.strengthReflection: The Divine appears in infinite forms, colors, and shapes — far beyond one image.
shloks.devotionalSurrender: O Lord, I open to see Your hundreds and thousands of divine forms.

shloks.sanskrit: पश्यादित्यान्वसून्रुद्रानश्विनौ मरुतस्तथा। बहून्यदृष्टपूर्वाणि पश्याश्चर्याणि भारत॥
shloks.transliteration: paśhyādityān vasūn rudrān aśhvinau marutas tathā bahūny adṛiṣhṭa-pūrvāṇi paśhyāśhcharyāṇi bhārata
shloks.simpleMeaning: See the Adityas, the Vasus, the Rudras, the Ashvins, and also the Maruts. See, O Arjuna, many wonders never seen before.
shloks.practicalExplanation: Specific divine beings appear: solar deities, elemental gods, storm gods, healing twins, wind lords. Plus many wonders never before seen. The vision includes the entire celestial administration of the cosmos.
shloks.strengthReflection: In divine vision, I see the cosmic hierarchy of beings I never imagined.
shloks.devotionalSurrender: Lord, show me the wonders I have never seen — the fullness of cosmic reality.

shloks.sanskrit: इहैकस्थं जगत्कृत्स्नं पश्याद्य सचराचरम्। मम देहे गुडाकेश यच्चान्यद्द्रष्टुमिच्छसि॥
shloks.transliteration: ihaika-sthaṁ jagat kṛitsnaṁ paśhyādya sa-charācharam mama dehe guḍākeśha yach chānyad draṣhṭum ichchhasi
shloks.simpleMeaning: See now the entire universe, with everything moving and non-moving, all at once in My body, O Arjuna, and whatever else you wish to see.
shloks.practicalExplanation: The entire universe — all that moves, all that's still — is visible within Krishna's cosmic form. Everything exists within Him. And anything else Arjuna wants to see is also available. This is the vision of unity: all in One.
shloks.strengthReflection: The entire universe exists within the Divine body. I too exist within God.
shloks.devotionalSurrender: O Lord, show me the universe within You, and everything I need to see.

shloks.sanskrit: न तु मां शक्यसे द्रष्टुमनेनैव स्वचक्षुषा। दिव्यं ददामि ते चक्षुः पश्य मे योगमैश्वरम्॥
shloks.transliteration: na tu māṁ śhakyase draṣhṭum anenaiva sva-chakṣhuṣhā divyaṁ dadāmi te chakṣhuḥ paśhya me yogam aiśhvaram
shloks.simpleMeaning: But you cannot see Me with these physical eyes. Therefore I give you divine vision. Behold My divine power!
shloks.practicalExplanation: Physical eyes cannot perceive the cosmic form. Krishna gifts divine vision (divya chakshus). This is grace — the capacity to see God is itself given by God. Human effort alone cannot reach this; divine enablement is required.
shloks.strengthReflection: To see the Divine, I need divine vision — a gift of grace, not effort alone.
shloks.devotionalSurrender: Lord, grant me the divine eyes to see what physical sight cannot reveal.

shloks.sanskrit: सञ्जय उवाच। एवमुक्त्वा ततो राजन्महायोगेश्वरो हरिः। दर्शयामास पार्थाय परमं रूपमैश्वरम्॥
shloks.transliteration: sañjaya uvācha evam uktvā tato rājan mahā-yogeśhvaro hariḥ darśhayām āsa pārthāya paramaṁ rūpam aiśhvaram
shloks.simpleMeaning: Sanjaya said: O King, having thus spoken, the great Lord of yoga, Hari, then revealed to Arjuna His supreme, divine form.
shloks.practicalExplanation: Sanjaya narrates to the blind king: Krishna, the great master of yoga, revealed His supreme form. The name 'Hari' (one who takes away) suggests this vision will remove all remaining doubt and delusion from Arjuna.
shloks.strengthReflection: The Divine reveals Himself to the ready seeker, removing all remaining doubts.
shloks.devotionalSurrender: O Lord Hari, reveal Your supreme form and take away my blindness.

shloks.sanskrit: अनेकवक्त्रनयनमनेकाद्भुतदर्शनम्। अनेकदिव्याभरणं दिव्यानेकोद्यतायुधम्॥
shloks.transliteration: aneka-vaktra-nayanam anekādbhuta-darśhanam aneka-divyābharaṇaṁ divyānekodyatāyudham
shloks.simpleMeaning: With many mouths and eyes, with many wondrous sights, with many divine ornaments, with many divine weapons raised...
shloks.practicalExplanation: The description of the cosmic form begins: countless mouths, countless eyes, countless wonders, countless divine ornaments, countless divine weapons. The number 'aneka' (many, countless) repeats — this form exceeds all counting.
shloks.strengthReflection: The Divine form exceeds all measurement — countless faces meet my gaze.
shloks.devotionalSurrender: O Lord of countless mouths and eyes, I behold Your infinite form.

shloks.sanskrit: दिव्यमाल्याम्बरधरं दिव्यगन्धानुलेपनम्। सर्वाश्चर्यमयं देवमनन्तं विश्वतोमुखम्॥
shloks.transliteration: divya-mālyāmbara-dharaṁ divya-gandhānulepanam sarvāśhcharya-mayaṁ devam anantaṁ viśhvato-mukham
shloks.simpleMeaning: ...wearing divine garlands and garments, anointed with divine fragrances, all-wonderful, infinite, with faces everywhere.
shloks.practicalExplanation: Divine garlands, robes, fragrances surround this form. It is all-wonderful (sarvashcharya), endless (ananta), and faces all directions (vishvatomukha). Beauty, fragrance, wonder, infinity, omnidirection — the senses are overwhelmed.
shloks.strengthReflection: Divine beauty, fragrance, and wonder fill every direction — I am surrounded by God.
shloks.devotionalSurrender: O infinite Lord facing all directions, Your beauty and fragrance overwhelm me.

shloks.sanskrit: दिवि सूर्यसहस्रस्य भवेद्युगपदुत्थिता। यदि भाः सदृशी सा स्याद्भासस्तस्य महात्मनः॥
shloks.transliteration: divi sūrya-sahasrasya bhaved yugapad utthitā yadi bhāḥ sadṛiśhī sā syād bhāsas tasya mahātmanaḥ
shloks.simpleMeaning: If a thousand suns were to rise together in the sky, such splendor might resemble the radiance of that great being.
shloks.practicalExplanation: The famous 'thousand suns' verse: imagine a thousand suns rising simultaneously — perhaps this might approximate the brilliance of the cosmic form. But even this analogy falls short. Language strains to describe the indescribable.
shloks.strengthReflection: Divine radiance exceeds a thousand suns — inconceivable light is my true nature's source.
shloks.devotionalSurrender: O Lord of inconceivable radiance, brighter than a thousand suns, shine within me.

shloks.sanskrit: तत्रैकस्थं जगत्कृत्स्नं प्रविभक्तमनेकधा। अपश्यद्देवदेवस्य शरीरे पाण्डवस्तदा॥
shloks.transliteration: tatraika-sthaṁ jagat kṛitsnaṁ pravibhaktam anekadhā apaśhyad deva-devasya śharīre pāṇḍavas tadā
shloks.simpleMeaning: There, in the body of the God of gods, Arjuna then saw the entire universe divided into many parts yet standing as one.
shloks.practicalExplanation: Arjuna sees what was promised: the whole universe, with its infinite divisions, contained within the body of Krishna. Unity and diversity coexist — many parts, one whole. This is the vision of non-dual reality: everything separate yet everything one.
shloks.strengthReflection: All diversity exists within divine unity — many parts, one whole.
shloks.devotionalSurrender: O God of gods, I see the universe within You — separate yet one.

shloks.sanskrit: ततः स विस्मयाविष्टो हृष्टरोमा धनञ्जयः। प्रणम्य शिरसा देवं कृताञ्जलिरभाषत॥
shloks.transliteration: tataḥ sa vismayāviṣhṭo hṛiṣhṭa-romā dhanañjayaḥ praṇamya śhirasā devaṁ kṛitāñjalir abhāṣhata
shloks.simpleMeaning: Then, filled with wonder, his hair standing on end, Arjuna bowed his head to the Lord and with joined palms, spoke.
shloks.practicalExplanation: Arjuna's response: vismaya (wonder), hrishtaroma (hair standing on end), pranama (bowing), kritanjali (palms joined). The body responds before words come. Physical signs of spiritual encounter — goosebumps, prostration, hands coming together in prayer.
shloks.strengthReflection: When I encounter the Divine truly, my body responds before my mind can process.
shloks.devotionalSurrender: O Lord, with hair standing on end and hands joined, I bow to You in wonder.

shloks.sanskrit: अर्जुन उवाच। पश्यामि देवांस्तव देव देहे सर्वांस्तथा भूतविशेषसङ्घान्। ब्रह्माणमीशं कमलासनस्थमृषींश्च सर्वानुरगांश्च दिव्यान्॥
shloks.transliteration: arjuna uvācha paśhyāmi devāns tava deva dehe sarvāns tathā bhūta-viśheṣha-saṅghān brahmāṇam īśhaṁ kamalāsana-stham ṛiṣhīnśh cha sarvān uragānśh cha divyān
shloks.simpleMeaning: Arjuna said: O Lord, I see within Your body all the gods and diverse beings, Brahma seated on his lotus throne, all the sages, and divine serpents.
shloks.practicalExplanation: Arjuna reports what he sees: all gods, all categories of beings, Brahma the creator on his lotus, all sages, divine serpents. The cosmic administration and its hierarchy are all visible within Krishna's form.
shloks.strengthReflection: All levels of cosmic existence are held within the Divine reality.
shloks.devotionalSurrender: O Lord, I see the entire cosmic hierarchy within Your body.

shloks.sanskrit: अनेकबाहूदरवक्त्रनेत्रं पश्यामि त्वां सर्वतोऽनन्तरूपम्। नान्तं न मध्यं न पुनस्तवादिं पश्यामि विश्वेश्वर विश्वरूप॥
shloks.transliteration: aneka-bāhūdara-vaktra-netraṁ paśhyāmi tvāṁ sarvato 'nanta-rūpam nāntaṁ na madhyaṁ na punas tavādiṁ paśhyāmi viśhveśhvara viśhva-rūpa
shloks.simpleMeaning: I see You with infinite arms, bellies, mouths, and eyes — Your form is endless everywhere. I see no beginning, middle, or end to You, O Lord of the universe, O universal form.
shloks.practicalExplanation: Infinite arms, bellies, mouths, eyes — in every direction, endless. And no beginning, middle, or end is visible. The form extends without boundary in space and time. Arjuna addresses Krishna as Vishveshvara (Lord of universe) and Vishvarupa (cosmic form).
shloks.strengthReflection: The Divine has no beginning, middle, or end — infinite in every dimension.
shloks.devotionalSurrender: O Lord of infinite form, I cannot find Your boundaries. You are everywhere.

shloks.sanskrit: किरीटिनं गदिनं चक्रिणं च तेजोराशिं सर्वतो दीप्तिमन्तम्। पश्यामि त्वां दुर्निरीक्ष्यं समन्ताद्दीप्तानलार्कद्युतिमप्रमेयम्॥
shloks.transliteration: kirīṭinaṁ gadinaṁ chakriṇaṁ cha tejo-rāśhiṁ sarvato dīptimantam paśhyāmi tvāṁ durnirīkṣhyaṁ samantād dīptānalārka-dyutim aprameyam
shloks.simpleMeaning: I see You with crown, mace, and discus, a mass of radiance shining everywhere, hard to look at, blazing like the brilliance of the sun and fire, immeasurable.
shloks.practicalExplanation: Divine symbols appear: crown (sovereignty), mace (power), discus (the wheel of time/dharma). The radiance is so intense it's hard to look at — like blazing fire and sun combined. And unmeasurable — beyond all calculation.
shloks.strengthReflection: Divine power, sovereignty, and radiance are too brilliant for ordinary eyes.
shloks.devotionalSurrender: O immeasurable Lord, Your brilliance overwhelms me. I bow to Your power.

shloks.sanskrit: त्वमक्षरं परमं वेदितव्यं त्वमस्य विश्वस्य परं निधानम्। त्वमव्ययः शाश्वतधर्मगोप्ता सनातनस्त्वं पुरुषो मतो मे॥
shloks.transliteration: tvam akṣharaṁ paramaṁ veditavyaṁ tvam asya viśhvasya paraṁ nidhānam tvam avyayaḥ śhāśhvata-dharma-goptā sanātanas tvaṁ puruṣho mato me
shloks.simpleMeaning: You are the imperishable, the supreme object of knowledge, the ultimate resting place of the universe, the unchanging protector of eternal dharma. I believe You are the eternal person.
shloks.practicalExplanation: Arjuna declares his understanding: Krishna is the supreme to be known, the ultimate refuge of everything, the eternal protector of dharma, the timeless Being. This is theological recognition flowing from direct vision.
shloks.strengthReflection: The Divine is the supreme knowledge, the ultimate refuge, the eternal protector.
shloks.devotionalSurrender: O eternal Lord, You are what I must know, where I must rest, who protects dharma forever.

shloks.sanskrit: अनादिमध्यान्तमनन्तवीर्यमनन्तबाहुं शशिसूर्यनेत्रम्। पश्यामि त्वां दीप्तहुताशवक्त्रं स्वतेजसा विश्वमिदं तपन्तम्॥
shloks.transliteration: anādi-madhyāntam ananta-vīryam ananta-bāhuṁ śhaśhi-sūrya-netram paśhyāmi tvāṁ dīpta-hutāśha-vaktraṁ sva-tejasā viśhvam idaṁ tapantam
shloks.simpleMeaning: I see You without beginning, middle, or end, with infinite power and infinite arms, the sun and moon as Your eyes, Your mouth a blazing fire, heating up this universe with Your radiance.
shloks.practicalExplanation: More vision details: timeless (no beginning, middle, end), infinite power, infinite arms. Sun and moon are His eyes, His mouth is blazing fire, His radiance heats the entire universe. The cosmic form governs all natural forces.
shloks.strengthReflection: Sun and moon serve as divine eyes; cosmic fire is divine speech.
shloks.devotionalSurrender: O Lord whose mouth is fire and eyes are sun and moon, Your radiance sustains all.

shloks.sanskrit: द्यावापृथिव्योरिदमन्तरं हि व्याप्तं त्वयैकेन दिशश्च सर्वाः। दृष्ट्वाद्भुतं रूपमुग्रं तवेदं लोकत्रयं प्रव्यथितं महात्मन्॥
shloks.transliteration: dyāvā-pṛithivyor idam antaraṁ hi vyāptaṁ tvayaikena diśhaśh cha sarvāḥ dṛiṣhṭvādbhutaṁ rūpam ugraṁ tavedaṁ loka-trayaṁ pravyathitaṁ mahātman
shloks.simpleMeaning: The space between heaven and earth and all directions is pervaded by You alone. Seeing this wondrous and terrible form, the three worlds tremble, O great soul.
shloks.practicalExplanation: Krishna fills all space — between heaven and earth, in every direction. This form is wondrous but also terrible (ugram). All three worlds tremble at this sight. The cosmic vision includes terror before the immensity of divine power.
shloks.strengthReflection: Before the fullness of divine power, even the worlds tremble.
shloks.devotionalSurrender: O great soul, Your form fills all space. I tremble before Your awesome power.

shloks.sanskrit: अमी हि त्वां सुरसङ्घा विशन्ति केचिद्भीताः प्राञ्जलयो गृणन्ति। स्वस्तीत्युक्त्वा महर्षिसिद्धसङ्घाः स्तुवन्ति त्वां स्तुतिभिः पुष्कलाभिः॥
shloks.transliteration: amī hi tvāṁ sura-saṅghā viśhanti kechid bhītāḥ prāñjalayo gṛiṇanti svastīty uktvā maharṣhi-siddha-saṅghāḥ stuvanti tvāṁ stutibhiḥ puṣhkalābhiḥ
shloks.simpleMeaning: Hosts of gods enter into You. Some, frightened, praise You with folded hands. Bands of great sages and perfected ones cry 'Hail!' and worship You with abundant hymns.
shloks.practicalExplanation: Divine beings themselves enter Krishna's form. Some do so in fear, praising with folded hands. Great sages and perfected ones chant blessings and hymns. Even celestials and sages are devotees before this cosmic reality.
shloks.strengthReflection: Even gods and sages worship the supreme reality with awe and hymns.
shloks.devotionalSurrender: O Lord, even the gods tremble and praise You. How much more should I!

shloks.sanskrit: रुद्रादित्या वसवो ये च साध्या विश्वेऽश्विनौ मरुतश्चोष्मपाश्च। गन्धर्वयक्षासुरसिद्धसङ्घा वीक्षन्ते त्वां विस्मिताश्चैव सर्वे॥
shloks.transliteration: rudrādityā vasavo ye cha sādhyā viśhve 'śhvinau marutaśh choṣhmapāśh cha gandharva-yakṣhāsura-siddha-saṅghā vīkṣhante tvāṁ vismitāśh chaiva sarve
shloks.simpleMeaning: The Rudras, Adityas, Vasus, Sadhyas, Vishvadevas, Ashvins, Maruts, ancestors, Gandharvas, Yakshas, Asuras, and Siddhas — all gaze upon You in amazement.
shloks.practicalExplanation: A catalog of celestial beings — storm gods, solar deities, elemental gods, healing twins, wind gods, ancestors, celestial musicians, nature spirits, demons, perfected ones — all watch in amazement. The entire cosmic hierarchy stands astonished.
shloks.strengthReflection: All categories of celestial beings are amazed at the full revelation of the Divine.
shloks.devotionalSurrender: O Lord, all beings in all realms gaze at You in wonder. I join them.

shloks.sanskrit: रूपं महत्ते बहुवक्त्रनेत्रं महाबाहो बहुबाहूरुपादम्। बहूदरं बहुदंष्ट्राकरालं दृष्ट्वा लोकाः प्रव्यथितास्तथाहम्॥
shloks.transliteration: rūpaṁ mahat te bahu-vaktra-netraṁ mahā-bāho bahu-bāhūru-pādam bahūdaraṁ bahu-danṣhṭrā-karālaṁ dṛiṣhṭvā lokāḥ pravyathitās tathāham
shloks.simpleMeaning: Seeing Your great form with many mouths and eyes, O mighty-armed, with many arms, thighs, and feet, with many bellies, and many terrible teeth — the worlds tremble, and so do I.
shloks.practicalExplanation: Arjuna describes again: many mouths, eyes, arms, legs, bellies, and terrible teeth. This form terrifies. The worlds shake, and Arjuna admits he too trembles. The vision of totality includes its terrifying aspects.
shloks.strengthReflection: Full vision of reality includes what is terrifying — and I face it.
shloks.devotionalSurrender: O Lord, Your terrible form makes the worlds and me tremble. I face my fear.

shloks.sanskrit: नभःस्पृशं दीप्तमनेकवर्णं व्यात्ताननं दीप्तविशालनेत्रम्। दृष्ट्वा हि त्वां प्रव्यथितान्तरात्मा धृतिं न विन्दामि शमं च विष्णो॥
shloks.transliteration: nabhaḥ-spṛiśhaṁ dīptam aneka-varṇaṁ vyāttānanaṁ dīpta-viśhāla-netram dṛiṣhṭvā hi tvāṁ pravyathitāntarātmā dhṛitiṁ na vindāmi śhamaṁ cha viṣhṇo
shloks.simpleMeaning: Seeing You touching the sky, blazing with many colors, with mouths wide open and huge fiery eyes, I am terrified to my core and find neither courage nor peace, O Vishnu.
shloks.practicalExplanation: The form touches the sky, blazes in multiple colors, has gaping mouths and huge fiery eyes. Arjuna confesses: his innermost being is shaken. He cannot find steadiness or peace. Direct encounter with the infinite overwhelms normal capacities.
shloks.strengthReflection: Encountering the infinite may overwhelm me — this is natural and honest.
shloks.devotionalSurrender: O Vishnu, Your form terrifies me to my core. I confess my lack of courage and peace.

shloks.sanskrit: दंष्ट्राकरालानि च ते मुखानि दृष्ट्वैव कालानलसन्निभानि। दिशो न जाने न लभे च शर्म प्रसीद देवेश जगन्निवास॥
shloks.transliteration: danṣhṭrā-karālāni cha te mukhāni dṛiṣhṭvaiva kālānala-sannibhāni diśho na jāne na labhe cha śharma prasīda deveśha jagan-nivāsa
shloks.simpleMeaning: Seeing Your mouths with terrible teeth, blazing like the fires of cosmic dissolution, I lose all sense of direction and find no shelter. Be gracious, O Lord of gods, refuge of the universe!
shloks.practicalExplanation: The teeth are terrible; the mouths blaze like doomsday fires. Arjuna loses all orientation and finds no safety anywhere. He begs for grace. This is the honest prayer when overwhelmed by divine magnitude: 'Be gracious!'
shloks.strengthReflection: When overwhelmed, I ask for divine grace — this is wisdom, not weakness.
shloks.devotionalSurrender: O Lord of the universe, I am disoriented and have no shelter. Be gracious to me!

shloks.sanskrit: अमी च त्वां धृतराष्ट्रस्य पुत्राः सर्वे सहैवावनिपालसङ्घैः। भीष्मो द्रोणः सूतपुत्रस्तथासौ सहास्मदीयैरपि योधमुख्यैः॥
shloks.transliteration: amī cha tvāṁ dhṛitarāṣhṭrasya putrāḥ sarve sahaivāvani-pāla-saṅghaiḥ bhīṣhmo droṇaḥ sūta-putras tathāsau sahāsmadīyair api yodha-mukhyaiḥ
shloks.simpleMeaning: All the sons of Dhritarashtra, along with hosts of kings, Bhishma, Drona, and Karna, together with the chief warriors on our side as well...
shloks.practicalExplanation: The vision shifts to the battlefield: Arjuna sees all the enemy warriors — Dhritarashtra's sons, allied kings, Bhishma, Drona, Karna — AND his own side's warriors. Both armies are visible within this cosmic vision.
shloks.strengthReflection: In the cosmic view, both sides of conflict are equally visible and included.
shloks.devotionalSurrender: O Lord, in Your vision I see both enemies and allies — all within You.

shloks.sanskrit: वक्त्राणि ते त्वरमाणा विशन्ति दंष्ट्राकरालानि भयानकानि। केचिद्विलग्ना दशनान्तरेषु सन्दृश्यन्ते चूर्णितैरुत्तमाङ्गैः॥
shloks.transliteration: vaktrāṇi te tvaramāṇā viśhanti danṣhṭrā-karālāni bhayānakāni kechid vilagnā daśhanāntareṣhu sandṛiśhyante chūrṇitair uttamāṅgaiḥ
shloks.simpleMeaning: ...rushing into Your fearful mouths with terrible teeth. Some are seen stuck between the teeth, their heads crushed.
shloks.practicalExplanation: A terrifying image: warriors rush into Krishna's fearful mouths. Some are caught between teeth, heads crushed. Time devours all. This is the vision of death as divine function — not comfortable, but true.
shloks.strengthReflection: Time consumes all. Seeing this truth clearly, I understand mortality.
shloks.devotionalSurrender: O Lord of time, I see all beings entering Your mouth. I accept this truth.

shloks.sanskrit: यथा नदीनां बहवोऽम्बुवेगाः समुद्रमेवाभिमुखा द्रवन्ति। तथा तवामी नरलोकवीरा विशन्ति वक्त्राण्यभिविज्वलन्ति॥
shloks.transliteration: yathā nadīnāṁ bahavo 'mbu-vegāḥ samudram evābhimukhā dravanti tathā tavāmī nara-loka-vīrā viśhanti vaktrāṇy abhivijvalanti
shloks.simpleMeaning: As many torrents of rivers flow toward the ocean, so do these heroes of the human world enter Your flaming mouths.
shloks.practicalExplanation: The simile of rivers flowing to the ocean: all these great warriors flow inevitably into Krishna's blazing mouths. Just as rivers can only go one direction, all beings move toward their divine destination. The current of time is irresistible.
shloks.strengthReflection: Like rivers to the ocean, all beings flow toward the Divine — no exceptions.
shloks.devotionalSurrender: O Lord, all heroes flow into You like rivers to the sea. I too flow to You.

shloks.sanskrit: यथा प्रदीप्तं ज्वलनं पतङ्गा विशन्ति नाशाय समृद्धवेगाः। तथैव नाशाय विशन्ति लोकास्तवापि वक्त्राणि समृद्धवेगाः॥
shloks.transliteration: yathā pradīptaṁ jvalanaṁ pataṅgā viśhanti nāśhāya samṛiddha-vegāḥ tathaiva nāśhāya viśhanti lokās tavāpi vaktrāṇi samṛiddha-vegāḥ
shloks.simpleMeaning: As moths rush into a blazing fire for their destruction, so do all creatures rush into Your mouths at full speed for their destruction.
shloks.practicalExplanation: Another terrifying image: moths drawn to flame rush to their death. Similarly, beings rush into Krishna's mouths with full velocity toward destruction. The attraction of time-death is irresistible. All lives end; this vision shows the mechanism.
shloks.strengthReflection: All beings rush toward their end — this truth, though harsh, is liberating.
shloks.devotionalSurrender: O Lord, like moths to flame, all rush to You. Let my rushing be conscious.

shloks.sanskrit: लेलिह्यसे ग्रसमानः समन्ताल्लोकान्समग्रान्वदनैर्ज्वलद्भिः। तेजोभिरापूर्य जगत्समग्रं भासस्तवोग्राः प्रतपन्ति विष्णो॥
shloks.transliteration: lelihyase grasamānaḥ samantāl lokān samagrān vadanair jvaladbhiḥ tejobhir āpūrya jagat samagraṁ bhāsas tavogrāḥ pratapanti viṣhṇo
shloks.simpleMeaning: You are licking up all the worlds with Your flaming mouths, devouring them on every side. Filling the whole universe with Your radiance, Your fierce rays burn, O Vishnu.
shloks.practicalExplanation: Krishna licks up worlds with flaming mouths, devours from all sides, fills the universe with fierce radiance. This is Time-Death as cosmic function. Vishnu's terrible aspect consumes everything. Nothing escapes.
shloks.strengthReflection: The universe is consumed by divine Time — everything passes, everything is transformed.
shloks.devotionalSurrender: O Vishnu, Your fierce rays consume all. Let me be transformed, not destroyed.

shloks.sanskrit: आख्याहि मे को भवानुग्ररूपो नमोऽस्तु ते देववर प्रसीद। विज्ञातुमिच्छामि भवन्तमाद्यं न हि प्रजानामि तव प्रवृत्तिम्॥
shloks.transliteration: ākhyāhi me ko bhavān ugra-rūpo namo 'stu te deva-vara prasīda vijñātum ichchhāmi bhavantam ādyaṁ na hi prajānāmi tava pravṛittim
shloks.simpleMeaning: Tell me, who are You with this terrible form? Salutations to You, O Supreme God. Be gracious. I wish to know You, the primal one, for I do not understand Your purpose.
shloks.practicalExplanation: Arjuna, overwhelmed, asks directly: who is this terrible one? He bows, begs for grace, wants to understand. He admits confusion about divine purpose. This honest question, born of genuine bewilderment, invites Krishna's self-revelation.
shloks.strengthReflection: When confused by divine mystery, I ask directly and honestly.
shloks.devotionalSurrender: O Supreme Lord, tell me who You are. I do not understand. Be gracious.

shloks.sanskrit: श्रीभगवानुवाच। कालोऽस्मि लोकक्षयकृत्प्रवृद्धो लोकान्समाहर्तुमिह प्रवृत्तः। ऋतेऽपि त्वां न भविष्यन्ति सर्वे येऽवस्थिताः प्रत्यनीकेषु योधाः॥
shloks.transliteration: śhrī bhagavān uvācha kālo 'smi loka-kṣhaya-kṛit pravṛiddho lokān samāhartum iha pravṛittaḥ ṛite 'pi tvāṁ na bhaviṣhyanti sarve ye 'vasthitāḥ pratyanīkeṣhu yodhāḥ
shloks.simpleMeaning: The Supreme Lord said: I am Time, the mighty destroyer of the world, engaged here in destroying all beings. Even without you, all these warriors arrayed in opposing armies shall cease to exist.
shloks.practicalExplanation: The famous revelation: 'I am Time (Kala), the world-destroyer.' Time has come to end these lives. Whether Arjuna fights or not, these warriors will die. The outcome is already determined. Arjuna is merely an instrument.
shloks.strengthReflection: Time destroys all. Understanding this, I act as instrument, not author.
shloks.devotionalSurrender: O Time, O Destroyer, all happens through You. I am Your instrument.

shloks.sanskrit: तस्मात्त्वमुत्तिष्ठ यशो लभस्व जित्वा शत्रून्भुङ्क्ष्व राज्यं समृद्धम्। मयैवैते निहताः पूर्वमेव निमित्तमात्रं भव सव्यसाचिन्॥
shloks.transliteration: tasmāt tvam uttiṣhṭha yaśho labhasva jitvā śhatrūn bhuṅkṣhva rājyaṁ samṛiddham mayaivaite nihatāḥ pūrvam eva nimitta-mātraṁ bhava savyasāchin
shloks.simpleMeaning: Therefore arise, win glory, conquer your enemies, and enjoy a prosperous kingdom. They have already been slain by Me. Be merely an instrument, O Arjuna.
shloks.practicalExplanation: The practical instruction: arise, fight, claim glory and kingdom. But know this: the enemies are ALREADY slain by Krishna. Arjuna is just the apparent cause (nimitta-matra). This liberates from doership while enabling full action.
shloks.strengthReflection: I act fully while knowing outcomes are already decided by divine will.
shloks.devotionalSurrender: O Lord, I arise as Your instrument. The glory is Yours; I am merely the tool.

shloks.sanskrit: द्रोणं च भीष्मं च जयद्रथं च कर्णं तथान्यानपि योधवीरान्। मया हतांस्त्वं जहि मा व्यथिष्ठा युध्यस्व जेतासि रणे सपत्नान्॥
shloks.transliteration: droṇaṁ cha bhīṣhmaṁ cha jayadrathaṁ cha karṇaṁ tathānyān api yodha-vīrān mayā hatāns tvaṁ jahi mā vyathiṣhṭhā yudhyasva jetāsi raṇe sapatnān
shloks.simpleMeaning: Drona, Bhishma, Jayadratha, Karna, and all other brave warriors have already been slain by Me. Kill them and do not be distressed. Fight! You shall certainly conquer your enemies in battle.
shloks.practicalExplanation: Names are given: Drona, Bhishma, Jayadratha, Karna — already killed by Krishna. Arjuna should slay them without distress. Victory is guaranteed. When you know divine will supports you, fight without anxiety. The outcome is assured.
shloks.strengthReflection: When aligned with divine will, I act without anxiety, knowing victory is assured.
shloks.devotionalSurrender: O Lord, these great ones are already slain by You. I fight without distress.

shloks.sanskrit: सञ्जय उवाच। एतच्छ्रुत्वा वचनं केशवस्य कृताञ्जलिर्वेपमानः किरीटी। नमस्कृत्वा भूय एवाह कृष्णं सगद्गदं भीतभीतः प्रणम्य॥
shloks.transliteration: sañjaya uvācha etach chhrutvā vachanaṁ keśhavasya kṛitāñjalir vepamānaḥ kirīṭī namaskṛitvā bhūya evāha kṛiṣhṇaṁ sa-gadgadaṁ bhīta-bhītaḥ praṇamya
shloks.simpleMeaning: Sanjaya said: Having heard these words of Keshava, Arjuna, trembling and with joined palms, bowed down again, and with a faltering voice, overwhelmed with fear, spoke to Krishna.
shloks.practicalExplanation: Sanjaya narrates Arjuna's condition: trembling, hands joined, bowing repeatedly, voice choking, overwhelmed by fear. The direct encounter with Time-Death shakes even the great warrior. Humility before the infinite is natural.
shloks.strengthReflection: Even the greatest warrior trembles before infinite reality. Humility is wisdom.
shloks.devotionalSurrender: O Lord, like Arjuna, I tremble and bow before Your overwhelming presence.

shloks.sanskrit: अर्जुन उवाच। स्थाने हृषीकेश तव प्रकीर्त्या जगत्प्रहृष्यत्यनुरज्यते च। रक्षांसि भीतानि दिशो द्रवन्ति सर्वे नमस्यन्ति च सिद्धसङ्घाः॥
shloks.transliteration: arjuna uvācha sthāne hṛiṣhīkeśha tava prakīrtyā jagat prahṛiṣhyaty anurajyate cha rakṣhānsi bhītāni diśho dravanti sarve namasyanti cha siddha-saṅghāḥ
shloks.simpleMeaning: Arjuna said: Rightly, O Hrishikesha, the world rejoices and is delighted in glorifying You. Demons flee in fear to all directions, while hosts of perfected ones bow to You.
shloks.practicalExplanation: Arjuna's hymn of praise begins: it is fitting that the world rejoices in Your glory. Demons flee in terror; perfected ones bow in devotion. The response to divine manifestation divides naturally: those aligned flee toward, those misaligned flee away.
shloks.strengthReflection: Encountering divine reality, alignment determines response — attraction or aversion.
shloks.devotionalSurrender: O Lord, the world rightly rejoices in You. I join the siddhas who bow.

shloks.sanskrit: कस्माच्च ते न नमेरन्महात्मन्गरीयसे ब्रह्मणोऽप्यादिकर्त्रे। अनन्त देवेश जगन्निवास त्वमक्षरं सदसत्तत्परं यत्॥
shloks.transliteration: kasmāch cha te na nameran mahātman garīyase brahmaṇo 'py ādi-kartre ananta deveśha jagan-nivāsa tvam akṣharaṁ sad-asat tat paraṁ yat
shloks.simpleMeaning: And why should they not bow to You, O great Soul — greater than Brahma, original creator, infinite, Lord of gods, abode of the universe? You are the imperishable, being and non-being, and that which is beyond both.
shloks.practicalExplanation: Why wouldn't everyone bow? You are greater than Brahma himself, the original creator, infinite, lord of gods, home of the universe, the imperishable, existence and non-existence and what transcends both. Every reason supports devotion.
shloks.strengthReflection: You are greater than any conceivable greatness — full devotion is the only response.
shloks.devotionalSurrender: O infinite Lord, greater than all, I bow to You who transcend being and non-being.

shloks.sanskrit: त्वमादिदेवः पुरुषः पुराणस्त्वमस्य विश्वस्य परं निधानम्। वेत्तासि वेद्यं च परं च धाम त्वया ततं विश्वमनन्तरूप॥
shloks.transliteration: tvam ādi-devaḥ puruṣhaḥ purāṇas tvam asya viśhvasya paraṁ nidhānam vettāsi vedyaṁ cha paraṁ cha dhāma tvayā tataṁ viśhvam ananta-rūpa
shloks.simpleMeaning: You are the primordial God, the ancient Being, the supreme resting place of all this universe. You are the knower, the known, and the supreme abode. By You, O infinite form, the universe is pervaded.
shloks.practicalExplanation: More praise: primordial God, ancient person, supreme refuge of the universe, the knower AND what is known, the supreme home. You pervade everything with Your infinite form. All categories of knowledge resolve in You.
shloks.strengthReflection: You are both knower and known — the subject and object of all knowledge unite in You.
shloks.devotionalSurrender: O primordial Lord, You are what I seek and who is seeking. All resides in You.

shloks.sanskrit: वायुर्यमोऽग्निर्वरुणः शशाङ्कः प्रजापतिस्त्वं प्रपितामहश्च। नमो नमस्तेऽस्तु सहस्रकृत्वः पुनश्च भूयोऽपि नमो नमस्ते॥
shloks.transliteration: vāyur yamo 'gnir varuṇaḥ śhaśhāṅkaḥ prajāpatis tvaṁ prapitāmahaśh cha namo namas te 'stu sahasra-kṛitvaḥ punaśh cha bhūyo 'pi namo namas te
shloks.simpleMeaning: You are Vayu (wind), Yama (death), Agni (fire), Varuna (water), the moon, Prajapati (creator), and the great-grandfather. Salutations, salutations to You a thousand times, and again and again salutations to You!
shloks.practicalExplanation: You are the gods of wind, death, fire, water; You are the moon, the creator, the great ancestor. Arjuna bows a thousand times, then again and again. Infinite bowing to infinite reality — one bow is never enough.
shloks.strengthReflection: Infinite divine reality deserves infinite devotion. One bow is never enough.
shloks.devotionalSurrender: O Lord, a thousand salutations, and again and again, I bow to You.

shloks.sanskrit: नमः पुरस्तादथ पृष्ठतस्ते नमोऽस्तु ते सर्वत एव सर्व। अनन्तवीर्यामितविक्रमस्त्वं सर्वं समाप्नोषि ततोऽसि सर्वः॥
shloks.transliteration: namaḥ purastād atha pṛiṣhṭhatas te namo 'stu te sarvata eva sarva ananta-vīryāmita-vikramas tvaṁ sarvaṁ samāpnoṣhi tato 'si sarvaḥ
shloks.simpleMeaning: Salutations to You from the front and from behind, salutations to You from all sides, O All! You are of infinite power and immeasurable might. You pervade all; therefore You are all.
shloks.practicalExplanation: Bowing from every direction — front, back, all sides. You are everything, Your power is infinite, Your prowess immeasurable. Because You pervade all, You ARE all. This is the conclusion of direct vision: pervading all, You are all.
shloks.strengthReflection: What pervades all is all. The Divine is not separate from anything.
shloks.devotionalSurrender: O All, I bow from every direction. You pervade all; You are all.

shloks.sanskrit: सखेति मत्वा प्रसभं यदुक्तं हे कृष्ण हे यादव हे सखेति। अजानता महिमानं तवेदं मया प्रमादात्प्रणयेन वापि॥
shloks.transliteration: sakheti matvā prasabhaṁ yad uktaṁ he kṛiṣhṇa he yādava he sakheti ajānatā mahimānaṁ tavedaṁ mayā pramādāt praṇayena vāpi
shloks.simpleMeaning: Whatever I have rashly said, thinking You to be merely a friend, calling You 'Hey Krishna, Hey Yadava, Hey Friend' — not knowing this glory of Yours, out of negligence or out of love...
shloks.practicalExplanation: Arjuna apologizes for past casualness. He had treated Krishna as just a friend — 'Hey Krishna!' — not knowing His true glory. Whether from negligence or affection, the informality now seems inappropriate after this cosmic vision.
shloks.strengthReflection: After seeing true glory, past casualness with the Divine seems incomplete.
shloks.devotionalSurrender: O Lord, forgive my casual address, born of ignorance or love. Now I know better.

shloks.sanskrit: यच्चावहासार्थमसत्कृतोऽसि विहारशय्यासनभोजनेषु। एकोऽथवाप्यच्युत तत्समक्षं तत्क्षामये त्वामहमप्रमेयम्॥
shloks.transliteration: yach chāvahāsārtham asat-kṛito 'si vihāra-śhayyāsana-bhojaneṣhu eko 'tha vāpy achyuta tat-samakṣhaṁ tat kṣhāmaye tvām aham aprameyam
shloks.simpleMeaning: And for whatever disrespect was shown to You in jest — while playing, resting, sitting, or dining, whether alone or in front of others — I ask Your forgiveness, O immeasurable one.
shloks.practicalExplanation: More apology: any disrespect in jest, while playing, resting, eating, in private or public — forgive all of it. Arjuna feels the weight of every casual moment. Before the immeasurable, we recalibrate all our behavior.
shloks.strengthReflection: Encountering greatness, I reconsider all past informality.
shloks.devotionalSurrender: O immeasurable Lord, forgive all my disrespect — in jest or seriousness.

shloks.sanskrit: पितासि लोकस्य चराचरस्य त्वमस्य पूज्यश्च गुरुर्गरीयान्। न त्वत्समोऽस्त्यभ्यधिकः कुतोऽन्यो लोकत्रयेऽप्यप्रतिमप्रभाव॥
shloks.transliteration: pitāsi lokasya charācharasya tvam asya pūjyaśh cha gurur garīyān na tvat-samo 'sty abhyadhikaḥ kuto 'nyo loka-traye 'py apratima-prabhāva
shloks.simpleMeaning: You are the father of this world, of the moving and non-moving, the worshipable and the greatest guru. There is none equal to You; how could there be anyone greater, O being of incomparable power in all three worlds?
shloks.practicalExplanation: You are father of all — moving and still. You are the supreme object of worship, the greatest teacher. None equals You; none could exceed You. In all three worlds, Your power has no comparison.
shloks.strengthReflection: No equal, no superior exists to the Divine. This is not pride but truth.
shloks.devotionalSurrender: O Father, Teacher, Lord without equal — I worship You with full heart.

shloks.sanskrit: तस्मात्प्रणम्य प्रणिधाय कायं प्रसादये त्वामहमीशमीड्यम्। पितेव पुत्रस्य सखेव सख्युः प्रियः प्रियायार्हसि देव सोढुम्॥
shloks.transliteration: tasmāt praṇamya praṇidhāya kāyaṁ prasādaye tvām aham īśham īḍyam piteva putrasya sakheva sakhyuḥ priyaḥ priyāyārhasi deva soḍhum
shloks.simpleMeaning: Therefore, bowing down and prostrating my body, I beg Your grace, O praiseworthy Lord. As a father to a son, as a friend to a friend, as a lover to beloved — please forgive me, O God.
shloks.practicalExplanation: Full prostration and request for grace. The relationships that call for tolerance — parent-child, friend-friend, lover-beloved — apply here. Arjuna asks Krishna to bear his faults as these intimate relationships naturally do.
shloks.strengthReflection: Intimate divine relationships allow for asking forgiveness with confidence.
shloks.devotionalSurrender: O Lord, as parent, friend, and beloved forgive offenses, please forgive mine.

shloks.sanskrit: अदृष्टपूर्वं हृषितोऽस्मि दृष्ट्वा भयेन च प्रव्यथितं मनो मे। तदेव मे दर्शय देव रूपं प्रसीद देवेश जगन्निवास॥
shloks.transliteration: adṛiṣhṭa-pūrvaṁ hṛiṣhito 'smi dṛiṣhṭvā bhayena cha pravyathitaṁ mano me tad eva me darśhaya deva rūpaṁ prasīda deveśha jagan-nivāsa
shloks.simpleMeaning: Having seen what was never seen before, I am thrilled, yet my mind is shaken with fear. Please show me that previous form, O God. Be gracious, O Lord of gods, refuge of the universe.
shloks.practicalExplanation: The paradox of vision: Arjuna is thrilled to see the unprecedented, yet terrified. He asks to return to the familiar form of Krishna. The cosmic vision is too much; the accessible, human form is requested. Grace grants both cosmic and intimate.
shloks.strengthReflection: Cosmic vision must be balanced by accessible intimacy with the Divine.
shloks.devotionalSurrender: O Lord, I have seen enough for now. Show me Your comforting, familiar form.

shloks.sanskrit: किरीटिनं गदिनं चक्रहस्तमिच्छामि त्वां द्रष्टुमहं तथैव। तेनैव रूपेण चतुर्भुजेन सहस्रबाहो भव विश्वमूर्ते॥
shloks.transliteration: kirīṭinaṁ gadinaṁ chakra-hastam ichchhāmi tvāṁ draṣhṭum ahaṁ tathaiva tenaiva rūpeṇa chatur-bhujena sahasra-bāho bhava viśhva-mūrte
shloks.simpleMeaning: I desire to see You as before, with crown, mace, and discus in hand. Assume that four-armed form, O thousand-armed one, O universal form.
shloks.practicalExplanation: Arjuna asks for the familiar Vishnu form — four-armed, with crown, mace, and chakra. Though the cosmic form has infinite arms, the four-armed form is what devotees can worship. The universal form must become personal to be loved.
shloks.strengthReflection: I need the Divine in accessible form to love and worship.
shloks.devotionalSurrender: O Lord, show me Your approachable form that I can adore.

shloks.sanskrit: श्रीभगवानुवाच। मया प्रसन्नेन तवार्जुनेदं रूपं परं दर्शितमात्मयोगात्। तेजोमयं विश्वमनन्तमाद्यं यन्मे त्वदन्येन न दृष्टपूर्वम्॥
shloks.transliteration: śhrī bhagavān uvācha mayā prasannena tavārjunedaṁ rūpaṁ paraṁ darśhitam ātma-yogāt tejo-mayaṁ viśhvam anantam ādyaṁ yan me tvad-anyena na dṛiṣhṭa-pūrvam
shloks.simpleMeaning: The Supreme Lord said: Arjuna, being pleased with you, I have shown you, by My divine yoga, this supreme form — radiant, universal, infinite, primordial — which no one but you has seen before.
shloks.practicalExplanation: Krishna explains: by grace (prasanna) and divine yoga, this supreme vision was shown. It is radiant, universal, infinite, primordial. No one else has seen this. Arjuna is uniquely blessed. The vision came from divine pleasure, not human effort alone.
shloks.strengthReflection: Supreme visions are granted through divine grace, not achieved through effort alone.
shloks.devotionalSurrender: O Lord, thank You for showing me what no other has seen. I am deeply blessed.

shloks.sanskrit: न वेदयज्ञाध्ययनैर्न दानैर्न च क्रियाभिर्न तपोभिरुग्रैः। एवंरूपः शक्य अहं नृलोके द्रष्टुं त्वदन्येन कुरुप्रवीर॥
shloks.transliteration: na veda-yajñādhyayanair na dānair na cha kriyābhir na tapobhir ugraiḥ evaṁ-rūpaḥ śhakya ahaṁ nṛi-loke draṣhṭuṁ tvad-anyena kuru-pravīra
shloks.simpleMeaning: Not by Vedic study, nor by sacrifices, nor by gifts, nor by rituals, nor by severe austerities, can I be seen in this form in the world of humans by anyone other than you, O great hero of the Kurus.
shloks.practicalExplanation: No amount of Vedic study, sacrifice, charity, ritual, or fierce austerity enables this vision. It cannot be bought or earned. Only by special grace to this one devotee was it shown. This humbles all spiritual practitioners: ultimate visions are gifts, not achievements.
shloks.strengthReflection: Final fruits of spiritual life are gifts, not achievements. I remain humble.
shloks.devotionalSurrender: O Lord, what I cannot earn by any effort, You gave freely. I am humbled.
