shloks.strengthReflection: I work to clarify my understanding beyond partial, confused knowing.
shloks.devotionalSurrender: O Lord, clear my intellect from confusion about right and wrong.

shloks.sanskrit: अधर्मं धर्ममिति या मन्यते तमसावृता। सर्वार्थान्विपरीतांश्च बुद्धिः सा पार्थ तामसी॥
shloks.transliteration: adharmaṁ dharmam iti yā manyate tamasāvṛitā sarvārthān viparītānśh cha buddhiḥ sā pārtha tāmasī
shloks.simpleMeaning: That intellect which, enveloped in darkness, considers adharma to be dharma, and sees all things perverted — that intellect, O Partha, is tamasic.
shloks.practicalExplanation: Tamasic intellect is completely inverted — calls wrong right, sees everything backwards, wrapped in darkness. This is spiritual blindness where evil appears good and good appears evil.
shloks.strengthReflection: I ensure my intellect isn't inverted, mistaking wrong for right.
shloks.devotionalSurrender: O Lord, protect me from inverted understanding that mistakes evil for good.

shloks.sanskrit: धृत्या यया धारयते मनःप्राणेन्द्रियक्रियाः। योगेनाव्यभिचारिण्या धृतिः सा पार्थ सात्त्विकी॥
shloks.transliteration: dhṛityā yayā dhārayate manaḥ-prāṇendriya-kriyāḥ yogenāvyabhichāriṇyā dhṛitiḥ sā pārtha sāttvikī
shloks.simpleMeaning: The unwavering steadiness by which one controls the activities of mind, breath, and senses through yoga — that steadiness, O Partha, is sattvic.
shloks.practicalExplanation: Sattvic determination controls mind, vital energy (prana), and senses through unwavering yoga practice. This steadiness maintains spiritual discipline without deviation — the foundation of self-mastery.
shloks.strengthReflection: I develop unwavering steadiness controlling mind, breath, and senses.
shloks.devotionalSurrender: O Lord, grant me sattvic steadiness in my spiritual practice.

shloks.sanskrit: यया तु धर्मकामार्थान्धृत्या धारयतेऽर्जुन। प्रसङ्गेन फलाकाङ्क्षी धृतिः सा पार्थ राजसी॥
shloks.transliteration: yayā tu dharma-kāmārthān dhṛityā dhārayate 'rjuna prasaṅgena phalākāṅkṣhī dhṛitiḥ sā pārtha rājasī
shloks.simpleMeaning: But the steadiness by which one holds to dharma, desire, and wealth, craving their fruits with attachment — that steadiness, O Partha, is rajasic.
shloks.practicalExplanation: Rajasic determination pursues religious duty (dharma), pleasure (kama), and wealth (artha) while craving results and remaining attached. It has discipline but for worldly gains, not liberation.
shloks.strengthReflection: I examine whether my determination seeks worldly rewards or liberation.
shloks.devotionalSurrender: O Lord, elevate my steadiness beyond seeking worldly fruits.

shloks.sanskrit: यया स्वप्नं भयं शोकं विषादं मदमेव च। न विमुञ्चति दुर्मेधा धृतिः सा पार्थ तामसी॥
shloks.transliteration: yayā svapnaṁ bhayaṁ śhokaṁ viṣhādaṁ madam eva cha na vimuñchati durmedhā dhṛitiḥ sā pārtha tāmasī
shloks.simpleMeaning: That steadiness by which a dull-witted person does not give up sleep, fear, grief, depression, and arrogance — that steadiness, O Partha, is tamasic.
shloks.practicalExplanation: Tamasic determination stubbornly holds onto excessive sleep, irrational fear, grief, depression, and pride. It's the stubbornness of ignorance — rigidly attached to negative states.
shloks.strengthReflection: I release stubbornness that clings to sleep, fear, grief, and negativity.
shloks.devotionalSurrender: O Lord, free me from tamasic clinging to negative states.

shloks.sanskrit: सुखं त्विदानीं त्रिविधं शृणु मे भरतर्षभ। अभ्यासाद्रमते यत्र दुःखान्तं च निगच्छति॥
shloks.transliteration: sukhaṁ tv idānīṁ tri-vidhaṁ śhṛiṇu me bharatarṣhabha abhyāsād ramate yatra duḥkhāntaṁ cha nigachchhati
shloks.simpleMeaning: Now hear from Me, O best of Bharatas, about the three kinds of happiness. That in which one rejoices through practice, and reaches the end of sorrow...
shloks.practicalExplanation: Krishna now describes three types of happiness. True happiness is cultivated through practice and leads to the end of suffering. This introduces the highest happiness — sattvic bliss.
shloks.strengthReflection: I seek happiness that grows through practice and ends all suffering.
shloks.devotionalSurrender: O Lord, teach me about the happiness that ends all sorrow.

shloks.sanskrit: यत्तदग्रे विषमिव परिणामेऽमृतोपमम्। तत्सुखं सात्त्विकं प्रोक्तमात्मबुद्धिप्रसादजम्॥
shloks.transliteration: yat tad agre viṣham iva pariṇāme 'mṛitopamam tat sukhaṁ sāttvikaṁ proktam ātma-buddhi-prasāda-jam
shloks.simpleMeaning: That happiness which is like poison in the beginning and nectar in the end, arising from the clarity of self-knowledge — that is declared to be sattvic.
shloks.practicalExplanation: Sattvic happiness seems difficult at first (like poison) but becomes nectar over time. It arises from clarity of understanding. Spiritual practice initially requires effort but yields lasting bliss.
shloks.strengthReflection: I embrace practices that seem difficult now but yield lasting happiness.
shloks.devotionalSurrender: O Lord, help me persist through initial difficulty to taste the nectar of sattvic joy.

shloks.sanskrit: विषयेन्द्रियसंयोगाद्यत्तदग्रेऽमृतोपमम्। परिणामे विषमिव तत्सुखं राजसं स्मृतम्॥
shloks.transliteration: viṣhayendriya-sanyogād yat tad agre 'mṛitopamam pariṇāme viṣham iva tat sukhaṁ rājasaṁ smṛitam
shloks.simpleMeaning: That happiness which arises from the contact of senses with their objects, which is like nectar in the beginning but like poison in the end — that is considered rajasic.
shloks.practicalExplanation: Rajasic happiness comes from sense pleasures — sweet at first but bitter later. Sensory indulgence seems delightful initially but leads to suffering, addiction, and depletion.
shloks.strengthReflection: I recognize sense pleasures that seem sweet now but turn bitter later.
shloks.devotionalSurrender: O Lord, help me see through rajasic pleasures to their painful results.

shloks.sanskrit: यदग्रे चानुबन्धे च सुखं मोहनमात्मनः। निद्रालस्यप्रमादोत्थं तत्तामसमुदाहृतम्॥
shloks.transliteration: yad agre chānubandhe cha sukhaṁ mohanam ātmanaḥ nidrālasya-pramādotthaṁ tat tāmasam udāhṛitam
shloks.simpleMeaning: That happiness which deludes the self both in the beginning and in the end, arising from sleep, laziness, and negligence — that is declared to be tamasic.
shloks.practicalExplanation: Tamasic happiness is deluding from start to finish. It comes from excessive sleep, laziness, and carelessness — numbing but never truly satisfying. This is the happiness of ignorance.
shloks.strengthReflection: I avoid the false happiness of excessive sleep, laziness, and neglect.
shloks.devotionalSurrender: O Lord, wake me from tamasic happiness that deludes and numbs.

shloks.sanskrit: न तदस्ति पृथिव्यां वा दिवि देवेषु वा पुनः। सत्त्वं प्रकृतिजैर्मुक्तं यदेभिः स्यात्त्रिभिर्गुणैः॥
shloks.transliteration: na tad asti pṛithivyāṁ vā divi deveṣhu vā punaḥ sattvaṁ prakṛiti-jair muktaṁ yadebhiḥ syāt tribhir guṇaiḥ
shloks.simpleMeaning: There is no being on earth, or among the gods in heaven, that is free from these three gunas born of Prakriti.
shloks.practicalExplanation: Everything in material existence — on earth or in heaven — is subject to the three gunas. Even celestial beings are bound by them. Only transcending material nature brings freedom.
shloks.strengthReflection: I understand that transcending the gunas is the path to true freedom.
shloks.devotionalSurrender: O Lord, help me transcend all three gunas to attain freedom.

shloks.sanskrit: ब्राह्मणक्षत्रियविशां शूद्राणां च परन्तप। कर्माणि प्रविभक्तानि स्वभावप्रभवैर्गुणैः॥
shloks.transliteration: brāhmaṇa-kṣhatriya-viśhāṁ śhūdrāṇāṁ cha parantapa karmāṇi pravibhaktāni svabhāva-prabhavair guṇaiḥ
shloks.simpleMeaning: The duties of Brahmanas, Kshatriyas, Vaishyas, and Shudras are distributed according to the qualities born of their own nature, O scorcher of foes.
shloks.practicalExplanation: Social duties are divided according to one's inherent nature and qualities — not by birth but by guna-makeup. Each person has a natural calling based on their psychological constitution.
shloks.strengthReflection: I identify my natural calling based on my inherent qualities and nature.
shloks.devotionalSurrender: O Lord, help me understand and fulfill my natural dharma.

shloks.sanskrit: शमो दमस्तपः शौचं क्षान्तिरार्जवमेव च। ज्ञानं विज्ञानमास्तिक्यं ब्रह्मकर्म स्वभावजम्॥
shloks.transliteration: śhamo damas tapaḥ śhauchaṁ kṣhāntir ārjavam eva cha jñānaṁ vijñānam āstikyaṁ brahma-karma svabhāva-jam
shloks.simpleMeaning: Serenity, self-control, austerity, purity, patience, uprightness, knowledge, wisdom, and faith — these are the duties of Brahmanas, born of their nature.
shloks.practicalExplanation: Those with Brahmana nature excel in: mental calm, sense control, discipline, purity, patience, honesty, knowledge, practical wisdom, and faith. These are scholarly/priestly qualities.
shloks.strengthReflection: I cultivate serenity, self-control, knowledge, and faith as spiritual qualities.
shloks.devotionalSurrender: O Lord, develop in me the qualities of wisdom, purity, and faith.

shloks.sanskrit: शौर्यं तेजो धृतिर्दाक्ष्यं युद्धे चाप्यपलायनम्। दानमीश्वरभावश्च क्षात्रं कर्म स्वभावजम्॥
shloks.transliteration: śhauryaṁ tejo dhṛitir dākṣhyaṁ yuddhe chāpy apalāyanam dānam īśhvara-bhāvaśh cha kṣhātraṁ karma svabhāva-jam
shloks.simpleMeaning: Heroism, vigor, fortitude, skill, not fleeing from battle, generosity, and leadership — these are the duties of Kshatriyas, born of their nature.
shloks.practicalExplanation: Those with Kshatriya nature excel in: courage, energy, determination, competence, standing firm in challenge, generosity, and authority. These are warrior/leader qualities.
shloks.strengthReflection: I cultivate courage, determination, and leadership when called for.
shloks.devotionalSurrender: O Lord, grant me courage and strength to face life's battles.

shloks.sanskrit: कृषिगौरक्ष्यवाणिज्यं वैश्यकर्म स्वभावजम्। परिचर्यात्मकं कर्म शूद्रस्यापि स्वभावजम्॥
shloks.transliteration: kṛiṣhi-gau-rakṣhya-vāṇijyaṁ vaiśhya-karma svabhāva-jam paricharyātmakaṁ karma śhūdrasyāpi svabhāva-jam
shloks.simpleMeaning: Agriculture, cattle-rearing, and trade are the duties of Vaishyas, born of their nature. Service is the duty of Shudras, born of their nature.
shloks.practicalExplanation: Those with Vaishya nature excel in commerce, agriculture, and animal husbandry. Those with Shudra nature serve through devoted labor. Each contributes according to their natural abilities.
shloks.strengthReflection: I honor all types of work as valuable contributions to society.
shloks.devotionalSurrender: O Lord, help me serve according to my nature without ego.

shloks.sanskrit: स्वे स्वे कर्मण्यभिरतः संसिद्धिं लभते नरः। स्वकर्मनिरतः सिद्धिं यथा विन्दति तच्छृणु॥
shloks.transliteration: sve sve karmaṇy abhirataḥ sansiddhiṁ labhate naraḥ sva-karma-nirataḥ siddhiṁ yathā vindati tach chṛiṇu
shloks.simpleMeaning: Each one, devoted to one's own duty, attains perfection. Hear how one devoted to one's own work finds perfection.
shloks.practicalExplanation: By dedicating oneself to one's natural duty, anyone can attain perfection. The path to liberation isn't about what work you do but how devotedly you do your own calling.
shloks.strengthReflection: I attain perfection by devotedly performing my natural duty.
shloks.devotionalSurrender: O Lord, help me find perfection through devoted performance of my calling.

shloks.sanskrit: यतः प्रवृत्तिर्भूतानां येन सर्वमिदं ततम्। स्वकर्मणा तमभ्यर्च्य सिद्धिं विन्दति मानवः॥
shloks.transliteration: yataḥ pravṛittir bhūtānāṁ yena sarvam idaṁ tatam sva-karmaṇā tam abhyarchya siddhiṁ vindati mānavaḥ
shloks.simpleMeaning: By worshipping Him from whom all beings originate and by whom all this is pervaded, through one's own work — a person finds perfection.
shloks.practicalExplanation: Worship God — from whom all beings arise and who pervades everything — through your own work. Any work becomes worship when offered to the Divine. This is the essence of karma yoga.
shloks.strengthReflection: I worship God through my work, making every task an offering.
shloks.devotionalSurrender: O Lord, I worship You through my work. Accept my efforts as offerings.

shloks.sanskrit: श्रेयान्स्वधर्मो विगुणः परधर्मात्स्वनुष्ठितात्। स्वभावनियतं कर्म कुर्वन्नाप्नोति किल्बिषम्॥
shloks.transliteration: śhreyān sva-dharmo viguṇaḥ para-dharmāt sv-anuṣhṭhitāt svabhāva-niyataṁ karma kurvan nāpnoti kilbiṣham
shloks.simpleMeaning: Better is one's own dharma, though imperfectly performed, than the dharma of another well performed. Performing action determined by one's nature, one does not incur sin.
shloks.practicalExplanation: It's better to do your own duty imperfectly than another's duty perfectly. Action aligned with your nature doesn't create negative karma. Authenticity trumps impressive performance of borrowed roles.
shloks.strengthReflection: I embrace my own path, even imperfect, rather than perfectly imitating another's.
shloks.devotionalSurrender: O Lord, help me find and follow my authentic dharma.

shloks.sanskrit: सहजं कर्म कौन्तेय सदोषमपि न त्यजेत्। सर्वारम्भा हि दोषेण धूमेनाग्निरिवावृताः॥
shloks.transliteration: sahajaṁ karma kaunteya sa-doṣham api na tyajet sarvārambhā hi doṣheṇa dhūmenāgnir ivāvṛitāḥ
shloks.simpleMeaning: One should not abandon one's natural work, O son of Kunti, even though it has defects. For all undertakings are covered by defects, as fire by smoke.
shloks.practicalExplanation: Don't abandon your natural calling even if it has flaws. All actions have some defect — like fire inevitably has smoke. Perfection isn't about finding flawless work but doing your work with devotion.
shloks.strengthReflection: I accept my work's imperfections and continue with devotion.
shloks.devotionalSurrender: O Lord, I offer my imperfect work to You, knowing all action has smoke.

shloks.sanskrit: असक्तबुद्धिः सर्वत्र जितात्मा विगतस्पृहः। नैष्कर्म्यसिद्धिं परमां संन्यासेनाधिगच्छति॥
shloks.transliteration: asakta-buddhiḥ sarvatra jitātmā vigata-spṛihaḥ naiṣhkarmya-siddhiṁ paramāṁ sannyāsenādhigachchhati
shloks.simpleMeaning: One whose intellect is unattached everywhere, who has conquered the self and is free from desire — attains the supreme state of freedom from action through renunciation.
shloks.practicalExplanation: With unattached intellect, self-mastery, and freedom from desire, one attains the supreme actionlessness (naishkarmya) through inner renunciation. Actions happen but don't bind — this is freedom while still active.
shloks.strengthReflection: Through detachment, self-mastery, and desirelessness, I attain freedom from karma.
shloks.devotionalSurrender: O Lord, grant me the supreme freedom from action's bondage.

shloks.sanskrit: सिद्धिं प्राप्तो यथा ब्रह्म तथाप्नोति निबोध मे। समासेनैव कौन्तेय निष्ठा ज्ञानस्य या परा॥
shloks.transliteration: siddhiṁ prāpto yathā brahma tathāpnoti nibodha me samāsenaiva kaunteya niṣhṭhā jñānasya yā parā
shloks.simpleMeaning: Learn from Me briefly, O son of Kunti, how one who has attained perfection also attains Brahman — the supreme consummation of knowledge.
shloks.practicalExplanation: Krishna will briefly explain how perfection leads to Brahman-realization—the ultimate goal of knowledge. This section describes the liberated state and how it's attained.
shloks.strengthReflection: I learn how perfection in action leads to ultimate realization.
shloks.devotionalSurrender: O Lord, teach me how to attain Brahman through perfection.

shloks.sanskrit: बुद्ध्या विशुद्धया युक्तो धृत्यात्मानं नियम्य च। शब्दादीन्विषयांस्त्यक्त्वा रागद्वेषौ व्युदस्य च॥
shloks.transliteration: buddhyā viśhuddhayā yukto dhṛityātmānaṁ niyamya cha śhabdādīn viṣhayāns tyaktvā rāga-dveṣhau vyudasya cha
shloks.simpleMeaning: Endowed with pure intellect, controlling the self with determination, relinquishing the objects of the senses beginning with sound, and casting off attachment and aversion...
shloks.practicalExplanation: The path to Brahman requires: purified intellect, determined self-control, withdrawal from sense objects, and freedom from likes and dislikes. These form the foundation of liberation.
shloks.strengthReflection: I purify my intellect, control myself, and release attachment and aversion.
shloks.devotionalSurrender: O Lord, purify my intellect and free me from likes and dislikes.

shloks.sanskrit: विविक्तसेवी लघ्वाशी यतवाक्कायमानसः। ध्यानयोगपरो नित्यं वैराग्यं समुपाश्रितः॥
shloks.transliteration: vivikta-sevī laghv-āśhī yata-vāk-kāya-mānasaḥ dhyāna-yoga-paro nityaṁ vairāgyaṁ samupāśhritaḥ
shloks.simpleMeaning: ...dwelling in solitude, eating lightly, controlling speech, body, and mind, constantly devoted to meditation and yoga, taking refuge in dispassion...
shloks.practicalExplanation: More requirements: solitude for contemplation, moderate eating, control of speech-body-mind, constant meditation practice, and firm dispassion. These disciplines prepare for liberation.
shloks.strengthReflection: I practice solitude, moderation, self-control, meditation, and dispassion.
shloks.devotionalSurrender: O Lord, establish me in these practices leading to liberation.

shloks.sanskrit: अहंकारं बलं दर्पं कामं क्रोधं परिग्रहम्। विमुच्य निर्ममः शान्तो ब्रह्मभूयाय कल्पते॥
shloks.transliteration: ahaṅkāraṁ balaṁ darpaṁ kāmaṁ krodhaṁ parigraham vimuchya nirmamaḥ śhānto brahma-bhūyāya kalpate
shloks.simpleMeaning: ...abandoning ego, force, arrogance, desire, anger, and possessiveness, free from 'mine'-ness, peaceful — one becomes fit for becoming Brahman.
shloks.practicalExplanation: Final requirements: release ego, aggression, pride, desire, anger, and ownership. Become free from possessiveness, peaceful within. Such a person is ready for Brahman-realization.
shloks.strengthReflection: I release ego, arrogance, desire, anger, and possessiveness to find peace.
shloks.devotionalSurrender: O Lord, free me from these obstacles so I become fit for You.

shloks.sanskrit: ब्रह्मभूतः प्रसन्नात्मा न शोचति न काङ्क्षति। समः सर्वेषु भूतेषु मद्भक्तिं लभते पराम्॥
shloks.transliteration: brahma-bhūtaḥ prasannātmā na śhochati na kāṅkṣhati samaḥ sarveṣhu bhūteṣhu mad-bhaktiṁ labhate parām
shloks.simpleMeaning: Having become Brahman, serene in the Self, one neither grieves nor desires. Being equal to all beings, one attains supreme devotion to Me.
shloks.practicalExplanation: The one who has become Brahman is serene, beyond grief and desire, equal toward all beings. From this state comes supreme devotion to Krishna. Knowledge culminates in devotion.
shloks.strengthReflection: Becoming Brahman, I am serene, equal to all, and supremely devoted.
shloks.devotionalSurrender: O Lord, let my realization culminate in supreme devotion to You.

shloks.sanskrit: भक्त्या मामभिजानाति यावान्यश्चास्मि तत्त्वतः। ततो मां तत्त्वतो ज्ञात्वा विशते तदनन्तरम्॥
shloks.transliteration: bhaktyā mām abhijānāti yāvān yaśh chāsmi tattvataḥ tato māṁ tattvato jñātvā viśhate tad-anantaram
shloks.simpleMeaning: Through devotion one knows Me — who I am and what I am in truth. Then, knowing Me in truth, one immediately enters into Me.
shloks.practicalExplanation: Through devotion comes true knowledge of Krishna — His complete nature and reality. Knowing Him truly, one immediately enters into Him. Devotion is both the path and the goal.
shloks.strengthReflection: Through devotion I truly know God and enter into union with Him.
shloks.devotionalSurrender: O Lord, through my devotion, let me know You truly and enter into You.

shloks.sanskrit: सर्वकर्माण्यपि सदा कुर्वाणो मद्व्यपाश्रयः। मत्प्रसादादवाप्नोति शाश्वतं पदमव्ययम्॥
shloks.transliteration: sarva-karmāṇy api sadā kurvāṇo mad-vyapāśhrayaḥ mat-prasādād avāpnoti śhāśhvataṁ padam avyayam
shloks.simpleMeaning: Though always performing all actions, one who has taken refuge in Me, by My grace attains the eternal, imperishable abode.
shloks.practicalExplanation: Even while performing all actions, one who takes refuge in Krishna attains the eternal abode by His grace. Action continues; bondage ends. Divine grace completes what effort begins.
shloks.strengthReflection: I take refuge in Krishna and, by His grace, attain the eternal abode.
shloks.devotionalSurrender: O Lord, I take refuge in You. By Your grace, grant me Your eternal abode.

shloks.sanskrit: चेतसा सर्वकर्माणि मयि संन्यस्य मत्परः। बुद्धियोगमुपाश्रित्य मच्चित्तः सततं भव॥
shloks.transliteration: chetasā sarva-karmāṇi mayi sannyasya mat-paraḥ buddhi-yogam upāśhritya mach-chittaḥ satataṁ bhava
shloks.simpleMeaning: Mentally dedicating all actions to Me, regarding Me as the Supreme, taking resort to the yoga of understanding — always keep your mind fixed on Me.
shloks.practicalExplanation: The practical instruction: mentally offer all actions to Krishna, consider Him supreme, practice buddhi yoga (intelligent devotion), and constantly keep your mind on Him. This is daily spiritual practice.
shloks.strengthReflection: I mentally offer all actions to Krishna with mind constantly fixed on Him.
shloks.devotionalSurrender: O Lord, I dedicate all actions to You. Let my mind be always on You.

shloks.sanskrit: मच्चित्तः सर्वदुर्गाणि मत्प्रसादात्तरिष्यसि। अथ चेत्त्वमहंकारान्न श्रोष्यसि विनङ्क्ष्यसि॥
shloks.transliteration: mach-chittaḥ sarva-durgāṇi mat-prasādāt tariṣhyasi atha chet tvam ahaṅkārān na śhroṣhyasi vinaṅkṣhyasi
shloks.simpleMeaning: With your mind on Me, by My grace you will cross over all difficulties. But if, out of ego, you do not listen, you shall perish.
shloks.practicalExplanation: With mind on Krishna, by His grace, all obstacles are overcome. But if ego prevents listening to divine guidance, destruction follows. This is both promise and warning.
shloks.strengthReflection: With mind on God, I cross all difficulties by grace. Ego leads to destruction.
shloks.devotionalSurrender: O Lord, by Your grace I will cross all obstacles. Remove my ego.

shloks.sanskrit: यदहंकारमाश्रित्य न योत्स्य इति मन्यसे। मिथ्यैष व्यवसायस्ते प्रकृतिस्त्वां नियोक्ष्यति॥
shloks.transliteration: yad ahaṅkāram āśhritya na yotsya iti manyase mithyaiṣha vyavasāyas te prakṛitis tvāṁ niyokṣhyati
shloks.simpleMeaning: If, taking refuge in ego, you think 'I will not fight,' your resolve is vain. Your nature will compel you.
shloks.practicalExplanation: If Arjuna's ego decides not to fight, that resolve is futile. His warrior nature will compel him. We cannot escape our inherent nature; better to act consciously than be driven unconsciously.
shloks.strengthReflection: I cannot escape my nature. Better to act consciously with spiritual awareness.
shloks.devotionalSurrender: O Lord, help me act consciously according to my nature, not from ego-resistance.

shloks.sanskrit: स्वभावजेन कौन्तेय निबद्धः स्वेन कर्मणा। कर्तुं नेच्छसि यन्मोहात्करिष्यस्यवशोऽपि तत्॥
shloks.transliteration: svabhāva-jena kaunteya nibaddhaḥ svena karmaṇā kartuṁ nechchhasi yan mohāt kariṣhyasy avaśho 'pi tat
shloks.simpleMeaning: Bound by your own karma born of your nature, O son of Kunti, what you wish not to do through delusion — you will do even helplessly.
shloks.practicalExplanation: Bound by your nature and karma, what you deludedly refuse, you will do helplessly. Fighting against one's nature is futile. Better to embrace it consciously and offer it to God.
shloks.strengthReflection: I embrace my nature consciously rather than fight it deludedly.
shloks.devotionalSurrender: O Lord, I accept my nature and offer my actions to You.

shloks.sanskrit: ईश्वरः सर्वभूतानां हृद्देशेऽर्जुन तिष्ठति। भ्रामयन्सर्वभूतानि यन्त्रारूढानि मायया॥
shloks.transliteration: īśhvaraḥ sarva-bhūtānāṁ hṛid-deśhe 'rjuna tiṣhṭhati bhrāmayan sarva-bhūtāni yantrārūḍhāni māyayā
shloks.simpleMeaning: The Lord dwells in the hearts of all beings, O Arjuna, causing all beings to revolve by His maya, as if mounted on a machine.
shloks.practicalExplanation: God dwells in every heart, causing all beings to move as if on a divine machine through His maya. We are not the ultimate movers — God operates through us. Surrender to the Operator within.
shloks.strengthReflection: God dwells in my heart, operating through me. I surrender to the inner Operator.
shloks.devotionalSurrender: O Lord in my heart, You are the true Operator. I surrender to You.

shloks.sanskrit: तमेव शरणं गच्छ सर्वभावेन भारत। तत्प्रसादात्परां शान्तिं स्थानं प्राप्स्यसि शाश्वतम्॥
shloks.transliteration: tam eva śharaṇaṁ gachchha sarva-bhāvena bhārata tat-prasādāt parāṁ śhāntiṁ sthānaṁ prāpsyasi śhāśhvatam
shloks.simpleMeaning: Take refuge in Him alone with all your being, O Bharata. By His grace you will attain supreme peace and the eternal abode.
shloks.practicalExplanation: Take refuge in that indwelling Lord with your entire being. By His grace comes supreme peace and the eternal home. This simple surrender is the essence of all teachings.
shloks.strengthReflection: I take refuge in God with all my being and receive His grace.
shloks.devotionalSurrender: O Lord, I take complete refuge in You. By Your grace, grant me eternal peace.

shloks.sanskrit: इति ते ज्ञानमाख्यातं गुह्याद्गुह्यतरं मया। विमृश्यैतदशेषेण यथेच्छसि तथा कुरु॥
shloks.transliteration: iti te jñānam ākhyātaṁ guhyād guhyataraṁ mayā vimṛiśhyaitad aśheṣheṇa yathechchhasi tathā kuru
shloks.simpleMeaning: Thus I have imparted to you knowledge that is more secret than all secrets. Reflect on this fully, and then do as you wish.
shloks.practicalExplanation: Krishna has shared the most secret knowledge. Now Arjuna must reflect deeply and choose freely. God doesn't coerce — He teaches and respects our free will. The choice is always ours.
shloks.strengthReflection: I reflect deeply on this teaching and make my choice freely.
shloks.devotionalSurrender: O Lord, I reflect on Your teaching and freely choose to follow You.

shloks.sanskrit: सर्वगुह्यतमं भूयः शृणु मे परमं वचः। इष्टोऽसि मे दृढमिति ततो वक्ष्यामि ते हितम्॥
shloks.transliteration: sarva-guhyatamaṁ bhūyaḥ śhṛiṇu me paramaṁ vachaḥ iṣhṭo 'si me dṛiḍham iti tato vakṣhyāmi te hitam
shloks.simpleMeaning: Hear again My supreme word, the most secret of all. You are very dear to Me; therefore I shall speak for your benefit.
shloks.practicalExplanation: Krishna offers His most secret teaching again because of deep love for Arjuna. Divine teaching comes from divine love. What follows is the essence of all essences.
shloks.strengthReflection: I am dear to God, and He speaks for my highest benefit.
shloks.devotionalSurrender: O Lord, I am cherished by You. I receive Your supreme teaching with love.

shloks.sanskrit: मन्मना भव मद्भक्तो मद्याजी मां नमस्कुरु। मामेवैष्यसि सत्यं ते प्रतिजाने प्रियोऽसि मे॥
shloks.transliteration: man-manā bhava mad-bhakto mad-yājī māṁ namaskuru mām evaiṣhyasi satyaṁ te pratijāne priyo 'si me
shloks.simpleMeaning: Fix your mind on Me, be devoted to Me, worship Me, bow to Me. You shall surely come to Me. I truly promise you, for you are dear to Me.
shloks.practicalExplanation: The essence: mind on Krishna, devoted to Krishna, worshipping Krishna, honoring Krishna. This guarantees attainment. Krishna promises — and His word is absolute. Love draws out this divine promise.
shloks.strengthReflection: I fix my mind on God, devote myself, worship, and honor Him. I will reach Him.
shloks.devotionalSurrender: O Lord, I set my mind on You, devote myself to You, worship and bow to You.

shloks.sanskrit: सर्वधर्मान्परित्यज्य मामेकं शरणं व्रज। अहं त्वा सर्वपापेभ्यो मोक्षयिष्यामि मा शुचः॥
shloks.transliteration: sarva-dharmān parityajya mām ekaṁ śharaṇaṁ vraja ahaṁ tvā sarva-pāpebhyo mokṣhayiṣhyāmi mā śhuchaḥ
shloks.simpleMeaning: Abandoning all dharmas, take refuge in Me alone. I will liberate you from all sins. Do not grieve.
shloks.practicalExplanation: The supreme verse: abandon all paths and take refuge in Krishna alone. He will free from all sins — no need to worry about past karma. Complete surrender brings complete liberation. This is the ultimate teaching.
shloks.strengthReflection: I surrender completely to God, releasing all concerns about past sins.
shloks.devotionalSurrender: O Lord, I abandon all else and take refuge in You alone. Free me from all sins.

shloks.sanskrit: इदं ते नातपस्काय नाभक्ताय कदाचन। न चाशुश्रूषवे वाच्यं न च मां योऽभ्यसूयति॥
shloks.transliteration: idaṁ te nātapaskāya nābhaktāya kadāchana na chāśhuśhrūṣhave vāchyaṁ na cha māṁ yo 'bhyasūyati
shloks.simpleMeaning: This should never be spoken to one without austerity, nor to one who is not devoted, nor to one who does not wish to hear, nor to one who speaks ill of Me.
shloks.practicalExplanation: This teaching should not be shared with: those lacking discipline, the non-devoted, those unwilling to listen, or those who criticize Krishna. Sacred teaching requires receptive hearts.
shloks.strengthReflection: I share sacred wisdom only with receptive, prepared hearts.
shloks.devotionalSurrender: O Lord, let me share Your teaching appropriately with worthy seekers.

shloks.sanskrit: य इमं परमं गुह्यं मद्भक्तेष्वभिधास्यति। भक्तिं मयि परां कृत्वा मामेवैष्यत्यसंशयः॥
shloks.transliteration: ya imaṁ paramaṁ guhyaṁ mad-bhakteṣhv abhidhāsyati bhaktiṁ mayi parāṁ kṛitvā mām evaiṣhyaty asanśhayaḥ
shloks.simpleMeaning: One who teaches this supreme secret to My devotees, performing the highest devotion to Me, shall without doubt come to Me.
shloks.practicalExplanation: Teaching this sacred knowledge to devotees is supreme devotion. Such a teacher will certainly reach Krishna. Sharing divine wisdom multiplies one's own merit and devotion.
shloks.strengthReflection: I share divine wisdom with devotees as an act of supreme devotion.
shloks.devotionalSurrender: O Lord, let me serve You by teaching Your wisdom to seekers.

shloks.sanskrit: न च तस्मान्मनुष्येषु कश्चिन्मे प्रियकृत्तमः। भविता न च मे तस्मादन्यः प्रियतरो भुवि॥
shloks.transliteration: na cha tasmān manuṣhyeṣhu kaśhchin me priya-kṛittamaḥ bhavitā na cha me tasmād anyaḥ priyataro bhuvi
shloks.simpleMeaning: No one among humans does dearer service to Me than this person, nor will there be anyone on earth dearer to Me.
shloks.practicalExplanation: No one does more beloved service than sharing this teaching. No one will be dearer to Krishna. The teacher of the Gita holds the highest place in divine affection.
shloks.strengthReflection: I serve God most dearly by sharing His teaching with sincere seekers.
shloks.devotionalSurrender: O Lord, let me be dear to You through sharing Your teaching.

shloks.sanskrit: अध्येष्यते च य इमं धर्म्यं संवादमावयोः। ज्ञानयज्ञेन तेनाहमिष्टः स्यामिति मे मतिः॥
shloks.transliteration: adhyeṣhyate cha ya imaṁ dharmyaṁ saṁvādam āvayoḥ jñāna-yajñena tenāham iṣhṭaḥ syām iti me matiḥ
shloks.simpleMeaning: And one who studies this sacred dialogue of ours — by that sacrifice of knowledge, I shall be worshipped. This is My conviction.
shloks.practicalExplanation: Studying this sacred dialogue is a sacrifice of knowledge (jnana yajna). Through such study, Krishna is worshipped. Reading the Gita is a form of divine worship.
shloks.strengthReflection: I worship God through studying this sacred dialogue.
shloks.devotionalSurrender: O Lord, I worship You through the study of Your teaching.

shloks.sanskrit: श्रद्धावाननसूयश्च शृणुयादपि यो नरः। सोऽपि मुक्तः शुभाँल्लोकान्प्राप्नुयात्पुण्यकर्मणाम्॥
shloks.transliteration: śhraddhāvān anasūyaśh cha śhṛiṇuyād api yo naraḥ so 'pi muktaḥ śhubhān lokān prāpnuyāt puṇya-karmaṇām
shloks.simpleMeaning: One who listens to this with faith and without envy — even such a person, being liberated, shall attain the auspicious worlds of the righteous.
shloks.practicalExplanation: Even listening to the Gita with faith and without criticism brings liberation and blessed realms. One need not understand everything — faithful, open listening brings spiritual benefit.
shloks.strengthReflection: I listen to divine teaching with faith and openness, receiving liberation.
shloks.devotionalSurrender: O Lord, I listen to Your teaching with faith. Grant me liberation.

shloks.sanskrit: कच्चिदेतच्छ्रुतं पार्थ त्वयैकाग्रेण चेतसा। कच्चिदज्ञानसम्मोहः प्रनष्टस्ते धनञ्जय॥
shloks.transliteration: kachchid etach chhrutaṁ pārtha tvayaikāgreṇa chetasā kachchid ajñāna-sammohaḥ pranaṣhṭas te dhanañjaya
shloks.simpleMeaning: Have you heard this with single-pointed attention, O Partha? Has your delusion born of ignorance been destroyed, O Dhananjaya?
shloks.practicalExplanation: Krishna asks Arjuna: Did you listen attentively? Is your confusion destroyed? The teaching is complete; now it must be received. Understanding requires attention; transformation requires reflection.
shloks.strengthReflection: I listen with complete attention. My delusion is destroyed.
shloks.devotionalSurrender: O Lord, I have heard. My delusion is destroyed by Your teaching.

shloks.sanskrit: अर्जुन उवाच। नष्टो मोहः स्मृतिर्लब्धा त्वत्प्रसादान्मयाच्युत। स्थितोऽस्मि गतसन्देहः करिष्ये वचनं तव॥
shloks.transliteration: arjuna uvācha naṣhṭo mohaḥ smṛitir labdhā tvat-prasādān mayāchyuta sthito 'smi gata-sandehaḥ kariṣhye vachanaṁ tava
shloks.simpleMeaning: Arjuna said: My delusion is destroyed. I have gained memory (wisdom) through Your grace, O Infallible One. I am firm, with doubts gone. I shall act according to Your word.
shloks.practicalExplanation: Arjuna's transformation is complete: delusion destroyed, wisdom gained, established firmly, doubts dissolved. He will follow Krishna's guidance. The teaching has achieved its purpose.
shloks.strengthReflection: My delusion is destroyed. I am firm. I will follow divine guidance.
shloks.devotionalSurrender: O Lord, by Your grace I am transformed. I will do as You say.

shloks.sanskrit: सञ्जय उवाच। इत्यहं वासुदेवस्य पार्थस्य च महात्मनः। संवादमिममश्रौषमद्भुतं रोमहर्षणम्॥
shloks.transliteration: sañjaya uvācha ity ahaṁ vāsudevasya pārthasya cha mahātmanaḥ saṁvādam imam aśhrauṣham adbhutaṁ roma-harṣhaṇam
shloks.simpleMeaning: Sanjaya said: Thus I have heard this wonderful, hair-raising dialogue between Vasudeva (Krishna) and the great-souled Partha (Arjuna).
shloks.practicalExplanation: Sanjaya concludes by describing his experience: he heard this wonderful, thrilling dialogue between Krishna and Arjuna. The teaching is so powerful it causes goosebumps — physical response to spiritual truth.
shloks.strengthReflection: This dialogue fills me with wonder and moves me to my core.
shloks.devotionalSurrender: O Lord, this dialogue between You and Arjuna thrills my soul.

shloks.sanskrit: व्यासप्रसादाच्छ्रुतवानेतद्गुह्यमहं परम्। योगं योगेश्वरात्कृष्णात्साक्षात्कथयतः स्वयम्॥
shloks.transliteration: vyāsa-prasādāch chhrutavān etad guhyam ahaṁ param yogaṁ yogeśhvarāt kṛiṣhṇāt sākṣhāt kathayataḥ svayam
shloks.simpleMeaning: By the grace of Vyasa, I have heard this supreme secret yoga directly from Krishna, the Lord of Yoga, speaking Himself.
shloks.practicalExplanation: Sanjaya received this teaching by Vyasa's grace — the mystic vision that allowed him to witness the dialogue. He heard directly from Krishna Himself, the Lord of all yoga. This authenticates the teaching.
shloks.strengthReflection: I receive this teaching by grace, directly from the Lord of Yoga.
shloks.devotionalSurrender: O Lord, by grace I receive Your supreme teaching directly from You.

shloks.sanskrit: राजन्संस्मृत्य संस्मृत्य संवादमिममद्भुतम्। केशवार्जुनयोः पुण्यं हृष्यामि च मुहुर्मुहुः॥
shloks.transliteration: rājan saṁsmṛitya saṁsmṛitya saṁvādam imam adbhutam keśhavārjunayoḥ puṇyaṁ hṛiṣhyāmi cha muhur muhuḥ
shloks.simpleMeaning: O King, remembering again and again this wonderful and holy dialogue between Keshava and Arjuna, I rejoice again and again.
shloks.practicalExplanation: Sanjaya tells Dhritarashtra: recalling this wonderful, sacred dialogue repeatedly brings repeated joy. The Gita's power increases with repetition — each remembering brings fresh delight.
shloks.strengthReflection: I remember this dialogue repeatedly and experience renewed joy each time.
shloks.devotionalSurrender: O Lord, remembering Your teaching brings me joy again and again.

shloks.sanskrit: तच्च संस्मृत्य संस्मृत्य रूपमत्यद्भुतं हरेः। विस्मयो मे महान्राजन्हृष्यामि च पुनः पुनः॥
shloks.transliteration: tach cha saṁsmṛitya saṁsmṛitya rūpam aty-adbhutaṁ hareḥ vismayo me mahān rājan hṛiṣhyāmi cha punaḥ punaḥ
shloks.simpleMeaning: And remembering again and again that most wonderful form of Hari (Krishna), great is my amazement, O King. I rejoice again and again.
shloks.practicalExplanation: Sanjaya also recalls the cosmic form of Krishna shown to Arjuna. That vision brings continued amazement and joy. Both the teaching and the divine vision bring ever-renewing wonder.
shloks.strengthReflection: The vision of God fills me with ever-fresh amazement and joy.
shloks.devotionalSurrender: O Lord, remembering Your wondrous form fills me with boundless joy.

shloks.sanskrit: यत्र योगेश्वरः कृष्णो यत्र पार्थो धनुर्धरः। तत्र श्रीर्विजयो भूतिर्ध्रुवा नीतिर्मतिर्मम॥
shloks.transliteration: yatra yogeśhvaraḥ kṛiṣhṇo yatra pārtho dhanur-dharaḥ tatra śhrīr vijayo bhūtir dhruvā nītir matir mama
shloks.simpleMeaning: Wherever there is Krishna, the Lord of Yoga, and wherever there is Arjuna, the archer — there are prosperity, victory, happiness, and sound morality. This is my conviction.
shloks.practicalExplanation: The final verse: wherever Krishna (God) and Arjuna (the devoted soul) unite, there is assured prosperity, victory, abundance, and righteousness. Divine-human partnership brings all auspiciousness. This is the Gita's ultimate promise.
shloks.strengthReflection: Where God and devoted soul unite, all auspiciousness follows.
shloks.devotionalSurrender: O Lord, united with You, I am assured prosperity, victory, and righteousness.
